wrapper.title: About this manual
wrapper.paragraph: This manual describes the RobotWare 7 system parameters by topic and type in an overview. It also covers some basic workflow descriptions on how to add, edit and delete parameters. This can be done via specific software tools, which are not described here, nor how to use them.
The manual covers the most common types and parameters in the topics Communication , Controller , I/O System , Man-machine communication , and Motion .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: This manual should be used as a reference during configuration of the robot system.

The manual includes parameters for both the basic robot system and selected software and hardware options. The option parameters require that you have the specified option installed in your robot system.
It is recommended that you create a backup or save the configuration files before changing any parameters.
This should be performed only by a trained technician.

wrapper.title: Who should read this manual?
wrapper.paragraph: This manual is intended for:

listitem.paragraph: production technicians
programmers
service technicians

wrapper.title: Prerequisites
wrapper.paragraph: The reader should be familiar with:

listitem.paragraph: industrial robots and terminology.
the RAPID programming language.
how to configure system parameters using RobotStudio or FlexPendant.

wrapper.title: Categories for user documentation from ABB Robotics
wrapper.paragraph: The user documentation from ABB Robotics is divided into a number of categories. This listing is based on the type of information in the documents, regardless of whether the products are standard or optional.
All documents can be found via myABB Business Portal, www.abb.com/myABB.

wrapper.title: Product manuals
wrapper.paragraph: Manipulators, controllers, DressPack, and most other hardware is delivered with a Product manual that generally contains:

listitem.paragraph: Safety information.
Installation and commissioning (descriptions of mechanical installation or electrical connections).
Maintenance (descriptions of all required preventive maintenance procedures including intervals and expected life time of parts).
Repair (descriptions of all recommended repair procedures including spare parts).
Calibration.
Troubleshooting.
Decommissioning.
Reference information (safety standards, unit conversions, screw joints, lists of tools).
Spare parts list with corresponding figures (or references to separate spare parts lists).
References to circuit diagrams.

wrapper.title: Technical reference manuals
wrapper.paragraph: The technical reference manuals describe reference information for robotics products, for example lubrication, the RAPID language, and system parameters.

wrapper.title: Application manuals
wrapper.paragraph: Specific applications (for example software or hardware options) are described in Application manuals. An application manual can describe one or several applications.
An application manual generally contains information about:

listitem.paragraph: The purpose of the application (what it does and when it is useful).
What is included (for example cables, I/O boards, RAPID instructions, system parameters, software).
How to install included or required hardware.
How to use the application.
Examples of how to use the application.

wrapper.title: Operating manuals
wrapper.paragraph: The operating manuals describe hands-on handling of the products. The manuals are aimed at those having first-hand operational contact with the product, that is production cell operators, programmers, and troubleshooters.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: System parameters describe the configuration of the robot system. The parameters are configured according to order on delivery.
By changing the parameters values, the performance of the system can be adjusted. The system parameters usually only need changing if the robot system is modified due to a changed process.

wrapper.title: Parameter structure
wrapper.paragraph: The parameters are grouped together in a number of different configuration areas, named topics. These topics are divided into different types of parameters.

For each type, a number of objects or instances can be defined, thus having the same type. Each such instance has a number of parameters, which must be given specific values. In some cases these parameters, depending on their values, are further structured in subparameters, also called arguments or action values.

wrapper.title: Topic definition
wrapper.paragraph: topic definition A topic is a configuration area with a specific collection of types.

There are several topics in the controller, each describing an area of the robot system. All parameters are stored in a data base. A separate configuration file is saved for each topic, it can also be generated while creating a backup. These files are known as cfg files (file extension .cfg). See Configuration files.

wrapper.title: Type definition and type instances
wrapper.paragraph: type definition A type is a section of a topic, which defines parameters of the same type. As indicated above, there can be many instances of the same type. All such instances are referred to with the name of the type. For example, an instance of the type Signal is called a Signal instance or just a Signal. Note that each separate signal instance has a unique name, for example digin1.

Some of the instances may be shown in the system configuration for display purposes only and are therefore read-only. They belong to the default configuration of the system and can not be modified. In the RobotStudio editor they are grayed-out and on the FlexPendant they are marked with a separate icon. Read-only instances are never stored in the customer configuration files, when a topic is stored in a cfg file.

wrapper.title: System parameters definition
wrapper.paragraph: system parameter definition All parameters of an instance are assigned a value to describe the robot system configuration.
The parameter values are normally predefined on delivery. The values are restricted to data type, and sometimes to be within an interval, which is described for each parameter in this manual.
Most parameters require a restart of the controller to take effect after being changed.
Some parameters are visible but not editable since they are a part of the system and should not be changed.

wrapper.title: Working with system parameters
wrapper.paragraph:
System parameters are configured using RobotStudio or the FlexPendant. This is detailed in
Operating manual RobotStudio
and
Operating manual OmniCore
.
A parameter can have a defined default value. A parameter with a default value will not be saved in the configuration file, but will be visible in the editors in RobotStudio and FlexPendant.

wrapper.title: Example illustration
wrapper.paragraph: This example illustrates the structure from topic, down to arguments (also called action values).

wrapper.title:
Configuration files configuration files
SIO.cfg
SYS.cfg
EIO.cfg
MMC.cfg
MOC.cfg
PROC.cfg
wrapper.paragraph: A configuration file is a text file that lists the values of system parameters, saved as configuration files (*.cfg).
The configuration files are included in system backups. A configuration parameter that is defined with a default value will not be listed in the configuration file.
Configuration files and backups shall not be loaded into systems running an older RobotWare version than the one they were created in.
Configuration files and backups are not guaranteed to be compatible between major releases of RobotWare and may need to be migrated after a RobotWare upgrade.

td.paragraph: Functions to simplify working with the system

wrapper.paragraph: For RobotWare 7, there is also a topic used by ABB for troubleshooting and debugging purposes, called Debug (DBG.cfg). This topic is not described in this manual and is not included in backups.
Only parameters which are visible from RobotStudio are described in this manual.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes how paths on the controller can be defined using environment variables.

wrapper.title: Environment variables

td.paragraph: The home folder in the active system, i.e.,
The root of the system partition on the controller, i.e.,

wrapper.paragraph: The environment variables in the examples exist by default in the system. An environment variable is only detected if it is placed first in a path.

wrapper.title: Current directory
wrapper.paragraph: Current directory is not defined but varies depending on what happens in the system. Therefore, all references should be defined with complete paths (or using environment variables).

wrapper.title: Mounted disks
wrapper.paragraph: To be able to use mounted disks in the paths, there must be an FTP or NFS connection to a running FTP/NFS server with read and write access to the directory. In the following example, the mounted disk is named pc:

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This chapter describes the types and parameters of the Communication topic. Each parameter is described in the section for its type.

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The Communication topic contains parameters for configuring the main computerâs connectivity using Ethernet ports.

section.title: The relation between physical Ethernet ports and system parameters

wrapper.title: Network segment overview
wrapper.paragraph: The Ethernet networks used by OmniCore are distributed into the following segments:

td.paragraph: Process equipment local to this specific robot.
Secondary public/factory network. Isolated from WAN.

wrapper.paragraph: For information regarding location of the Ethernet port connectors, see the Product manual for the respective OmniCore controller.

wrapper.title: IP addresses IP address
wrapper.paragraph:
See
Operating manual Integrator's guide OmniCore
, section Configuring networks.

wrapper.title: Configuration
wrapper.paragraph:
See
Operating manual Integrator's guide OmniCore
, section Configuring networks.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Connected Services which belongs to the topic Communication . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph: Connected Services, type RobotWare software comes with built-in functionality that can be activated on each robot system to connect it to ABB Connected Services Cloud. Prerequisites to connect a robot with Connected Services :

listitem.paragraph: A valid service agreement, including each robot that can be connected.
Network connectivity between the robot and Internet. Note that the connection to ABB Connected Services Cloud is always initiated by RobotWare.

wrapper.paragraph: This type contains parameters used by the RobotWare to enable connectivity to ABB Connected Services Cloud.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Enabled belongs to the type Connected Services , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Enabled specifies if robot will connect to ABB Connected Services Cloud or not.

When enabling the connection for the first time, ensure that all other relevant connectivity parameters are specified. For more information about setup and connectivity of Connected Services , see
Application manual Controller software OmniCore
.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is True (Yes).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Connection Type belongs to the type Connected Services , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Connection Type defines what type of network connection will be used by RobotWare to connect to ABB Connected Services Cloud . RobotWare insure communication based on the selected Connection Type .

wrapper.title: Allowed values

td.paragraph: The communication will be done through the ABB Connect network port connected to the Connected Services Gateway Module.
The communication will be done through the Public network port (WAN) according to Gateway and DNS available.

wrapper.paragraph: If the Connection Type is set to Public , field Enable on Public in the firewall settings must be set to YES for Connected Services .
See The Firewall Manager type.

td.paragraph: The communication will be done through a specified gateway and DNS.

wrapper.paragraph: The default value is ABB Connect .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Internet Gateway IP belongs to the type Connected Services , in the topic Communication . Only if the Connection Type is Custom.

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use Internet Gateway IP parameter to specify the custom gateway.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Used to route connected services communication.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Internet DNS IP belongs to the type Connected Services , in the topic Communication . Only if the Connection Type is Custom.

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use the Internet DNS IP parameter to specify the custom DNS.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Used for the domain name resolution.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Proxy Used belongs to the type Connected Services , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The Proxy Used parameter specifies if a HTTP proxy should be used or not.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is Not Defined (No).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Proxy Name belongs to the type Connected Services , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The Proxy Name parameter specifies the name of the HTTP proxy server.

wrapper.title: Prerequisites
wrapper.paragraph: Used only if the value of the Proxy Used parameter is Yes .
For more details, see Proxy Used.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum of 64 characters.
The default value is empty.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Proxy Port belongs to the type Connected Services , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The Proxy Port parameter specifies which port is used by the HTTP proxy server.

wrapper.title: Prerequisites
wrapper.paragraph: Use only if the value of the Proxy Used parameter is Yes .
See Proxy Used.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: An integer between 1 and 65535.
The default value is 0.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Proxy Auth belongs to the type Connected Services , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The Proxy Auth parameter defines the proxy authentication type used for connecting with the proxy server.

wrapper.title: Allowed values

td.paragraph: Basic authentication method used to connect to the proxy server.

wrapper.paragraph: The default value is None .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Proxy User belongs to the type Connected Services , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The Proxy User parameter defines the user name that authenticates with the proxy server.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum of 64 characters.
The default value is empty.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Proxy Password belongs to the type Connected Services , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The Proxy Password parameter defines the password used for the authentication with the proxy server.
The password will be stored encrypted in configuration.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum of 64 characters.
The default value is empty.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Server Polling belongs to the type Connected Services , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The Server Polling parameter defines the frequency of server interactions.

wrapper.title: Allowed values

td.paragraph: Will consume less data (10 minutes polling rate).
Will consume more data (1 minute polling rate).

wrapper.paragraph: The default value is Slow .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Debug Mode belongs to the type Connected Services , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The Debug Mode parameter enables the extensive logging for debugging the issues.

wrapper.title: Allowed values

td.paragraph: Disables the generation of debug logs.
Enables the generation of debug logs.

wrapper.paragraph: The default value is Disabled .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Trace Level belongs to the type Connected Services , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The Trace Level parameter controls the level of logging if the parameter Debug Mode is enabled.

wrapper.title: Prerequisites
wrapper.paragraph: Used only if the value of the Debug Mode parameter is Enabled . For more details, see Debug Mode.

wrapper.title: Allowed values

td.paragraph: Log file contains normal level of debug information.
Log file contains detailed level of debug information

wrapper.paragraph: The default value is Normal .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Connected Services Mode belongs to the type Connected Services , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph:
The
Connected Services Mode
parameter defines the compatibility for different robot controller's data format, cloud solution, and specific features.

section.title: Type Connected Services Gateway 3G Connected Services Gateway 3G

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Connected Services Gateway 3G , which belongs to the topic Communication . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The Connected Services Gateway 3G type allows to edit and configure the Connected Services Gateway 3G parameters based on the installed SIM card and the Connected Services Gateway 3G module.
The Connected Services Gateway 3G configuration is used when a Connected Services Gateway 3G module is installed in the controller.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Enable 3G connection belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway 3G , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Enables or disables the communication for the Connected Services Gateway 3G module.

wrapper.title: Allowed values

td.paragraph: Enables the Connected Services Gateway 3G module.
Disables the Connected Services Gateway 3G module.

wrapper.paragraph: The default value is True (Yes) .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Roaming belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway 3G , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Enables or disables the roaming. By default, roaming is required for ABB SIM card.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is True (Yes) .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Access Point Name belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway 3G , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Access point name used by the SIM card to connect to the network.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is abbrobotics.com for ABB SIM card.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: User belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway 3G , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: It is the user name of the APN which authenticates with the server.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is empty, which means no user authentication.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Password belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway 3G , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Password used for login with the user, if required.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is empty, which indicates no password is required.

wrapper.title: Additional information
wrapper.paragraph: The password will be stored encrypted.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Pin belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway 3G , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: If the SIM is secured with PIN, type the PIN number in this field. By default ABB SIM card has no PIN.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The numerical pin number is empty if there is no pin.

wrapper.title: Additional information
wrapper.paragraph: The pin will be stored encrypted.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Operator belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway 3G , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Type the operator ID for force connection to a specific mobile operator.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The default is empty which defines automatic detection.

wrapper.title: Additional information
wrapper.paragraph: An operator ID is defined by the combination of MCC (Mobile Country Code) and MNC (Mobile Network Code).
Example: 20801 for Orange France
MCC: 208 for France
MNC: 01 for Orange

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Band belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway 3G , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Select the specific network band.

wrapper.title: Allowed values

td.paragraph: Empty string means automatic band detection.

wrapper.paragraph: The default value is Automatic (empty string) .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Authentication belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway 3G , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Select the authentication method.

wrapper.title: Allowed values

td.paragraph: Empty string means automatic detection of authentication type.

wrapper.paragraph: The default value is Automatic (empty string) .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Idle belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway 3G , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Type the Idle time (in seconds) to specify the idle time required before hanging up the connection.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is 0 .

wrapper.title: Additional information
wrapper.paragraph: Not implemented

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Delay belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway 3G , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Type the duration (in seconds) between a connection time out and retry.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is 0, which means auto reconnect immediately.

wrapper.title: Additional information
wrapper.paragraph: Not implemented

section.title: Type Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi
The Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi type

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi , which belongs to the topic Communication . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi type allows to edit and configure the Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi parameters for the Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi module.
The Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi configuration is used when a Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi module is installed in the controller.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Enable Wi-Fi connection belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Enables or disables the communication for the Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi module.

wrapper.title: Allowed values

td.paragraph: Enables the Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi module.
Disables the Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi module.

wrapper.paragraph: The default value is True (Yes) .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: SSID belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Type the SSID of the wireless network to which the module need to be connected.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Key belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Type the security key of the SSID.

wrapper.title: Additional information
wrapper.paragraph: The key will be stored encrypted.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Security belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway Wi-Fi , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Select the type of security required.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is empty string (Automatic). .

section.title: Type Connected Services Gateway Wired Connected Services Gateway Wired
The Connected Services Gateway Wired type

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Connected Services Gateway Wired , which belongs to the topic Communication . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph: The Connected Services Gateway Wired type allows to edit and configure Connected Services Gateway Wired parameters for the Connected Services Gateway Wired module.
The Connected Services Gateway Wired configuration is used when a Connected Services Gateway Wired module is installed in the controller.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: State belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway Wired , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Enables or disables the communication for the Connected Services Gateway Wired module.

wrapper.title: Allowed values

td.paragraph: Enables the Connected Services Gateway Wired module.
Disables the Connected Services Gateway Wired module.

wrapper.paragraph: The default value is True (Yes) .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: IP Address belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway Wired , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Type the IP address of the ABB Connect port on the wired network.
Before assigning the IP address for the wired module make sure the IP address has been assigned to your module by the network administrator.
For the Connected Services 4G gateway, the value must be set to 192.168.126.2

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Subnet Mask belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway Wired , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Type the subnet mask of the ABB Connect port.
For the Connected Services 4G gateway, the value must be set to 255.255.255.0

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Gateway belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway Wired , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Type the IP address of the external gateway.
For the Connected Services 4G gateway, the value must be set to 192.168.126.1

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Primary DNS Server belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway Wired , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Type the IP address of the external primary DNS server.
For the Connected Services 4G gateway, the value must be set to 192.168.126.1

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Secondary DNS Server belongs to the type Connected Services Gateway Wired , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Type the IP address of the secondary DNS server, if available.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type DNS Client , which belongs to the topic Communication . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph: DNS Client, type The type DNS Client is used to enable, disable, and change parameters for OmniCore DNS Client.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type DNS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Must exist and be set to DNS Client .

wrapper.title: Default value
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is DNSC .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Enabled belongs to the type DNS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: This defines the DNS Client is turned on or off.

wrapper.title: Default value
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is No .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Domain Name belongs to the type DNS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the domain where the host is located. If it is not defined, the DNS users must provide fully qualified domain names in address lookups.

wrapper.title: Default value
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is an empty string.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 80 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: 1st Name Server belongs to the type DNS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the primary name server. If it is not defined, the DNS Client will not perform any lookups.

wrapper.title: Default value
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is an empty string.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: 2nd Name Server belongs to the type DNS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the secondary name server.

wrapper.title: Default value
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is an empty string.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: 3rd Name Server belongs to the type DNS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the third name server.

wrapper.title: Default value
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is an empty string.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: 4th Name Server belongs to the type DNS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the fourth name server.

wrapper.title: Default value
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is an empty string.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Server Port belongs to the type DNS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the port used by the DNS Client for DNS queries. This parameter is rarely changed.

wrapper.title: Default value
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is 53 .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Retries belongs to the type DNS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the number of retries used by the DNS Client for DNS queries. This number is carried out for each name server. This parameter is rarely changed.

wrapper.title: Default value
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is 2 .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Timeout belongs to the type DNS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the timeout in seconds used by the DNS Client between retries. This parameter is rarely changed.

wrapper.title: Default value
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is 10 .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: IPv4 Zone Name belongs to the type DNS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the zone used by the DNS Client for address-to-name lookups of IPv4 addresses. This parameter is rarely changed.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 80 characters.

section.title:
The Firewall Manager type firewall
Firewall Manager

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Firewall Manager , which belongs to the topic Communication . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph: Firewall Manager, type The type Firewall Manager is used to configure the network firewall on the controller.
Only pre-registered network services can be configured. It is not possible to add new network services.

wrapper.title: Default configuration
wrapper.paragraph: The following table contains default values for pre-registered network services. These services will always be shown. The list might contain more services depending on which options are installed in the system.

annotation.paragraph: This value cannot be changed. It must be enabled on the private network for connection of RobotStudio and FlexPendant to the controller.

wrapper.paragraph: All default services and application protocols, except DHCP client, are disabled by default on the Public Network. All communication via the Public Network must be manually enabled.
In order to be able to connect to the Public network and perform basic RAPID tasks, the following must be enabled in the firewall:

wrapper.title: Examples
wrapper.paragraph: The following list shows a few examples of services that must be enabled for certain functions:

listitem.paragraph: If RobotStudio should display all available controllers on the network, the service Netscan must be set to Yes on the Public Network.
For a complete experience of the RobotStudio functionality, Netscan, RobAPI and RobotWebServices must be set to Yes on the Public Network.
To use Connected Services on Public port Connected Services must be set to Yes on the Public network. If not, the Connected Services status will be blocked.

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph:
Application manual Controller software OmniCore
.

Operating manual Integrator's guide OmniCore
.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Network Service belongs to the type Firewall Manager , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Network Service defines the name of a network service which can be enabled or disabled on the private network, public network or I/O network.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Examples
wrapper.paragraph: The following list shows a few examples of network services names:

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Enable on Public Network belongs to the type Firewall Manager , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Enable on Public Network defines if the network service is enabled or disabled on the public network.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set the value to Yes to enable the communication on the public network.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.
Default value is No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Enable on Private Network belongs to the type Firewall Manager , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Enable on Private Network defines if the network service is enabled or disabled on the private network.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set the value to Yes to enable the communication on the private network.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Enable on I/O Network belongs to the type Firewall Manager , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Enable on I/O Network defines if the network service is enabled or disabled on the I/O network.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set the value to Yes to enable the communication on the I/O network.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type FTP Client , which belongs to the topic Communication . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph: FTP Client, type The type FTP Client is used to configure FTP.

Appropriate RobotWare options need to be installed. For more details, see
Application manual Controller software OmniCore
.

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph:
Application manual Controller software OmniCore
.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type FTP Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The name used when accessing the FTP mounted disk.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: When the connection is used from a RAPID program or the FlexPendant, it is referenced with the parameter Name .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 40 characters.

wrapper.title: Example
wrapper.paragraph: The remote mounted disk is used for a connection with unit C: on a remote PC. If Name is set to ftp1, the file C:\ftp.modx can be accessed from a RAPID program as ftp1/ftp.modx.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Server Address belongs to the type FTP Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The IP address of the computer that runs the server application that the protocol communicates with.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If the protocol is used for communication with a remote computer, the IP address of that computer is specified in Server Address .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string consisting of 4 integer values between 0 and 255, each specifying one of the four parts, separated by dots.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Server Type belongs to the type FTP Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The type of server the client is connected to.

paragraph.phrase: FileZilla version 0.x, FileZilla version 1.x, MS IIS, Serv-U, Linux Ubuntu.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Trusted belongs to the type FTP Client, in the topic Communication.

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: A flag that specifies if losing the connection should make the program stop.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: A protocol used for backups or similar can have Trusted set to No. If the connection is lost, the program continues and the backup can be made later.

An protocol that relies on the connection for safety must have Trusted set to Yes. If the connection is lost, the program will stop and no hazardous situations can occur because of the lost connection.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Server Path belongs to the type FTP Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The name of the disk or folder to connect to, on a remote computer.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with a maximum of 40 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Username belongs to the type FTP Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The user name used by the robot when it logs on to an FTP server on a remote computer.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Create a user account on the FTP server. The user name of this account is then specified in Username , and the password in Password . For more information, see Password.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with a maximum of 40 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Password belongs to the type FTP Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The password used by the robot when it logs on to an FTP server on a remote computer.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Create a user account on the FTP server. The user name of this account is then specified in Username , and the password in Password . For more information, see Username.
The password will be, if not already, encrypted. The encrypted string will map to the original password only on the original controller.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with a maximum of 40 characters. Encrypted strings can be longer.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Show Device belongs to the type FTP Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Show Device defines if the storage device should be visible in the list of storage devices on the FlexPendant.

If the path of the storage device is known to the user, it is possible to access that storage device by entering the path in the open/save dialogs on the FlexPendant, regardless of the value of the Show Device parameter.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type IP Setting , which belongs to the topic Communication . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph: Ethernet Port, type The type IP Setting is used to set an address to a network interface of the main computer. If necessary, multiple addresses can be set for the same interface (multi-homing an interface).

wrapper.title: Additional information
wrapper.paragraph: The following instances of IP Setting are locked and cannot be edited or removed by configuring system parameters:

listitem.paragraph: 192.168.127.0 (only for internal use by the controller)
Public Network (set up using RobotStudio or FlexPendant)

wrapper.paragraph: RobAPI clients (for example RobotStudio, FlexPendant, and PC SDK) can access the robot controller via the Private Network, FlexPendant Network or Public Network.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type IV Camera , which belongs to the topic Communication . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph: IV Camera, type The type IV Camera is used to configure the camera for Integrated Vision .

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph:
Application manual Integrated Vision
.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type IV Camera , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The name of the camera in the controller. Each camera must have a unique name.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 40 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Username belongs to the type IV Camera , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The username used by the controller when it logs on to the camera.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 40 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Password belongs to the type IV Camera , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The password used by the controller when it logs on to the camera. The password is encrypted.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with a maximum of 40 characters. Encrypted strings can be longer.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: MAC Address belongs to the type IV Camera , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The mac address assigned to the NIC of the camera.
This parameter is read-only.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Communication Timeout belongs to the type IV Camera , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Communication Timeout defines the time that the controller will wait for a response from the camera. If a request to the camera results in a communication timeout, the reason can be that the camera is disconnected or that it needs more time to process the result.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 1 and 120000 milliseconds.
The default value is 5000 milliseconds.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Output to Rapid belongs to the type IV Camera , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Output to Rapid defines if the controller will manage the result of a photo request. The camera produces results for each photo request. If Output to Rapid is set to Yes , the result is converted to RAPID variables, which means that the photo request is managed by the controller and the instruction CamGetResult can be used to get the result.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Max Time Image Request belongs to the type IV Camera , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Max Time Image Result defines the time that the controller will wait for the result from a photo request. The time for the photo request depends on the complexity of the vision job. If a request to the camera results in a communication timeout, the reason can be that the camera is disconnected or that it needs more time to process the result.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is 120 seconds.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type NFS Client , which belongs to the topic Communication . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph: NFS Client, type The type NFS Client is used to configure NFS.

Appropriate RobotWare options need to be installed. For more details, see
Application manual Controller software OmniCore
.

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph:
Application manual Controller software OmniCore
.

wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type NFS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The name used when accessing the NFS mounted disk.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: When the connection is used from a RAPID program or the FlexPendant, it is referenced with the parameter Name .

wrapper.title: Allowed values

wrapper.title: Example
wrapper.paragraph: The remote mounted disk is used for a connection with unit C: on a remote PC. If Name is set to nfs1, the file C:\nfs.modx can be accessed from a RAPID program as nfs1/nfs.modx.

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The IP address of the computer that runs the server application that the protocol communicates with.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If the protocol is used for communication with a remote computer, the IP address of that computer is specified in Server Address .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string consisting of 4 integer values between 0 and 255, each specifying one of the four parts, separated by dots.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Server Type belongs to the type NFS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The type of server to which the NFS client is connected.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: XLink or Default .
This value can be left empty for all servers apart from XLink .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Trusted belongs to the type NFS Client, in the topic Communication.

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: A flag that specifies if losing the connection should make the program stop.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: A protocol used for backups or similar can have Trusted set to No. If the connection is lost, the program continues and the backup can be made later.

An protocol that relies on the connection for safety must have Trusted set to Yes. If the connection is lost, the program will stop and no hazardous situations can occur because of the lost connection.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: User ID belongs to the type NFS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Used by the NFS protocol as a way of authorizing the user to access a specific server.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If the NFS server requires a User ID and Group ID for access to the server, these numbers are specified in the parameters User ID and Group ID . For more information, see Group ID.
If this parameter is not used, set it to the default value 0.
Note that User ID must be the same for all mountings on one controller.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: An integer between 0 and 2,147,483,647.
Default value is 0.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Group ID belongs to the type NFS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Used by the NFS protocol as a way of authorizing the user to access a specific server.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If the NFS server requires a User ID and Group ID for access to the server, these numbers are specified in the parameters User ID and Group ID . For more information, see User ID.
If this parameter is not used, set it to the default value 0.
Note that Group ID must be the same for all mountings on one controller.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: An integer between 0 and 2,147,483,647.
Default value is 0.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Show Device belongs to the type NFS Client , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Show Device defines if the storage device should be visible in the list of storage devices on the FlexPendant.

If the path of the storage device is known to the user, it is possible to access that storage device by entering the path in the open/save dialogs on the FlexPendant, regardless of the value of the Show Device parameter.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type OPC UA Server , which belongs to the topic Communication . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph: OPC UA Server, type The type OPC UA Server is used to configure OPC UA server.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Enabled belongs to the type OPC UA Server , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Enabled defines if the integrated OPC UA server is started or not.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.
Default value is No.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Port Forward , which belongs to the topic Communication . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph: The port forwarding configuration can be used to reach a server/device located on a different network in the controller. One example is having a built-in webserver on a device on the IO network that needs to be reached from a Private or Public network.

This functionality uses Network Address Translation (NAT) and will automatically opens the associated port in the controller firewall. For the communication to work in both ways, the server/device must have a default gateway set that points back to the controller. For instance, a server/device on the private network needs to have a default gateway set to 192.168.125.1 which is the controller address on that network.
The following forwarding is possible:

listitem.paragraph: Public Network -> Private Network
Public Network -> I/O Network
Private Network -> I/O Network

wrapper.paragraph: Since network traffic will flow through the controller, high bandwidth applications could negatively affect the controller performance.

wrapper.title: Public Network -> Private Network on C line/V line
wrapper.paragraph: Topology where the web server on a camera on the Private Network needs to be viewed on the web browser on a PC residing on the Public Network:
Corresponding system parameter configuration:

wrapper.title: Private Network -> I/O Network on C line/V line
wrapper.paragraph: Topology where sensors on the I/O network needs to be configured with a PC tool connected to the management port (Private Network):
Corresponding system parameter configuration:

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph:
Operating manual Integrator's guide OmniCore
.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Port Forward , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Specifies a name that to be used for identification.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 80 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Listen Network belongs to the type Port Forward , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Specifies which of the controller networks will be listening for the incoming connections.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with the value:

listitem.paragraph: Public Network
Private Network

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Listen Port belongs to the type Port Forward , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Specifies which port on the controller will be opened to listen for the incoming connections.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A number between 1025 and 65535.
Specifying a port number that is already in use by another service on the controller will block that communication.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Forward to Network belongs to the type Port Forward , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Specifies on which of the controller networks the server exists where the communication is forwarded to.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with the value:

listitem.paragraph: Private Network
IO Network

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Forward to Address belongs to the type Port Forward , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Specifies the IP address of the server where the communication is forwarded to.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Any IP address between 0.0.0.0 and 255.255.255.255

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Forward to Port belongs to the type Port Forward , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Specifies the port number of the server where the communication is forwarded to.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A number between 1 and 65535.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Protocol belongs to the type Port Forward , in the topic Communication .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Specifies the protocol, which needs to be either TCP or UDP, for the communication.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string containing tcp or udp.
