wrapper.paragraph: Collision Delta Position (m) belongs to the type Force Master , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Collision Delta Position (m) defines the distance the servo tool has gone beyond the contact position when the motor torque has reached the value specified in Collision Alarm Torque .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Collision Delta Position (m) is used for the first gun closing of new tip calibrations and tool change calibrations. This affects the position calibration.

The best way to determine the collision position (where the tool tips meet) is to keep closing the gun until the motor torque reach the value specified in Collision Alarm Torque . The distance the gun then has moved beyond the collision position is defined in Collision Delta Position .
Changing the value of Collision Delta Position (m) can remove a constant calibration error, but does not have any effect if repetitive tip wear calibrations give varying results.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Collision Delta Position (m) can only be used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 1 meters.
The default value is 0.0019 m.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Force Detection Bandwidth belongs to the type Force Master , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the bandwidth for the force detection filter.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The force detection filter is used to filter the speed of the servo tool. The filtered speed is used to detect if the ordered force has been reached.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Force Detection Bandwidth can only be used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 1 and 124 Hz.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Delay Ramp belongs to the type Force Master , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Delays the starting of torque ramp when force control is started.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Delay Ramp can be used to give the servo gun some time to stabilize before the force control starts. A higher value of Delay Ramp can result in better accuracy of the squeeze force but will increase the cycle time.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Delay Ramp can only be used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 1 (seconds).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Ramp to Real Contact belongs to the type Force Master , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Determines if the feedback position should be used instead of reference position when deciding the contact position.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Setting Ramp to Real Contact to Yes will make the detection of the contact position (where the force control starts) more exact and improve the accuracy of the squeeze force, but increase the cycle time.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Ramp to Real Contact can only be used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Force Detection Min Time belongs to the type Force Master , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the time in the start before the condition of force ready will be evaluated.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Filtered speed is used to detect if the ordered force has been reached. If the gun seems to weld before force is built up, likely due to high friction, it can be a false trigger of low speed in the initial ramp.
This value can in those cases be increased.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Force Detection Min Time is only used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: An value between 0 and 1 second.
Default value is 0.060 seconds.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Leak Control for Search Signal
Leak Control for Search Signal belongs to the type Force Master , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Leak Control for Search Signal defines the leak factor of the search.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: When search for plate is activate in a spot welding instruction, the servo gun will perform a movement towards the plate and stops immediately when the plate is found. The plate is considered to be found when the signal value is bigger than Threshold for Search Trigger .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Leak Control for Search Signal is only used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 10000.
Default value is 0.1. This must be tuned depending on gun characteristics.

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph: Search Threshold.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Bandwidth of Speed Error Filter
Bandwidth of Speed Error Filter belongs to the type Force Master , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Bandwidth of Speed Error Filter defines the bandwidth of the Low Pass filter used in the search process.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: To avoid false search stops due to noisy signals the speed error is filtered by a Low Pass filter. The cut-off frequency is set by the parameter Bandwidth of Speed Error Filter .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Bandwidth of Speed Error Filter is only used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: An value between 0.1 and 250 Hz.
Default value is 10 Hz.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Threshold for Search Trigger
Threshold for Search Trigger belongs to the type Force Master , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Threshold for Search Trigger defines the trigger level of the search hit.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: When search for plate is activate in a spot welding instruction, the servo gun will perform a movement towards the plate and stops immediately when the plate is found. The plate is considered to be found when the signal value is bigger than Threshold for Search Trigger .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Threshold for Search Trigger is only used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 10000.
Default value is 3. This must be tuned depending on gun characteristics.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Search reverse distance
Search reverse distance belongs to the type Force Master , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Search reverse distance defines how long distance the gun arm should move in opposite direction directly after a search hit.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: When search for plate is activate in a spot welding instruction, the servo gun will perform a movement towards the plate and stops immediately when the plate is found. To reduce search impact as much as possible the gun will automatically move in the opposite direction directly after the plate is found.
The return distance is set by the parameter Search reverse distance .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Search reverse distance is only used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 0.01 meters.
Default value is 0.002 (2 mm).

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Force Master Control , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of the type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
force master control, type
Force Master Control is used to prevent a servo tool from closing with too high a speed.

If a servo tool is not completely closed when the force control starts, it can gain too much speed, which can cause damage when contact is reached. This can happen if the programmed thickness is too high, or if the servo tool tips are not properly calibrated.

If the tool is ordered to close with a higher force, it might tolerate a higher speed at impact. The speed limit can be defined as a function of the closing torque, which is a function of the ordered tip force. The loop gain used for regulating the speed when it exceeds the limit is also specified.
Up to 6 points can be defined for speed limit and speed loop gain.

Speed limit 1 and Kv 1 are valid for all torque values lower than torque 1 . The highest defined speed limit and loop gain are valid for all torque values higher than the highest defined torque. For torque values between defined points, linear interpolation is used.
If only one point is defined, that speed limit and speed loop gain is valid for all torque values.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Force Master Control can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Example
wrapper.paragraph: In this example, two points are used to define the speed limit and speed loop gain. Any values given for point 3 to 6 are ignored.
The parameters in the type Force Master Control are set to the following values:
The results of this configuration are the following graphs for speed limit and speed loop gain:

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Force Master Control , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The name of the Force Master Control .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Name is used to reference a Force Master Control from the parameter Use Force Master in the type Force Master .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: No. of Speed Limits belongs to the type Force Master Control , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: No. of Speed Limits defines the number of torque values you want to define for speed limit and speed loop gain, i.e. the number of points in the speed limit graph (see Example).

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Define the speed limit and speed loop gain you want for a number of torque values. Set No. of Speed Limits to the number of torque values you want to specify.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: No. of Speed Limits can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: An integer between 1 and 6.
The default value is 1.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Torque 1 belongs to the type Force Master Control , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Torque 1 defines the ordered closing torque for the first point in the speed limit graph (see Example).

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Define the speed limit and speed loop gain you want for some torque values. Set Torque 1 to the torque value of the first point you want to specify.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Torque 1 is used for servo tools and can only be used if you have the option Tool Control.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A number between -1000 and 1000 in Nm.
The default value is 1 Nm.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Torque 2 belongs to the type Force Master Control , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Torque 2 defines the ordered closing torque for the second point (if more than one) in the speed limit graph (see Example).

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Define the speed limit and speed loop gain you want for some torque values. Set Torque 2 to the torque value of the second point you want to specify.
It is possible to change the values to index 6 manually by changing a MOC.cfg.

wrapper.title: Prerequisites
wrapper.paragraph: No. of Speed Limits must be set to 2 or higher, otherwise the value of Torque 2 is not used. For more information, see No. of Speed Limits.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Torque 2 can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A number between -1000 and 1000 in Nm.
The default value is 2 Nm.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Speed Limit 1 belongs to the type Force Master Control , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Speed Limit 1 defines the maximum allowed speed for the torque specified in torque 1 . For more information, see torque 1.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Speed Limit 1 to the speed limit for the first point you want to specify in the speed limit graph (see Example).

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Speed Limit 1 can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A number between 0.001 and 100000 in rad/s on the motor side.
The default value is 300.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Speed Limit 2 belongs to the type Force Master Control , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Speed Limit 2 defines the maximum allowed speed for the torque specified in torque 2 . For more information, see torque 2.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Speed Limit 2 to the speed limit for the second point (if more than one) you want to specify in the speed limit graph (see Example).
It is possible to change the values to index 6 manually by changing a MOC.cfg.

wrapper.title: Prerequisites
wrapper.paragraph: No. of Speed Limits must be set to 2 or higher, otherwise the value of Speed Limit 2 is not used. For more information, see No. of Speed Limits.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Speed Limit 2 can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A number between 0.001 and 100000 in rad/s on the motor side.
The default value is 300.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Kv 1 belongs to the type Force Master Control , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Kv 1 defines the proportional gain in the speed loop for the torque specified in torque 1 . This gain determines how fast the speed is regulated when the speed limit is exceeded. For more information, see torque 1.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Kv 1 to the proportional gain you want for the first point in the speed limit graph (see Example).

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Kv 1 can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A number between 0.001 and 100.
The default value is 0.5.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Kv 2 belongs to the type Force Master Control , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Kv 2 defines the proportional gain in the speed loop for the torque specified in torque 2 . This gain determines how fast the speed is regulated when the speed limit is exceeded. For more information, see torque 2.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Kv 2 to the proportional gain you want for the second point (if more than one) in the speed limit graph (see Example).
It is possible to change the values to index 6 manually by changing a MOC.cfg.

wrapper.title: Prerequisites
wrapper.paragraph: No. of Speed Limits must be set to 2 or higher, otherwise the value of Kv 2 is not used. For more information, see No. of Speed Limits.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Kv 2 can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A number between 0.001 and 100.
The default value is 0.5.

title.phrase: Speed limit factor in force mode

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Speed limit factor in force mode belongs to the type Force Master Control , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: When force is built up and tool is squeezing, the Speed limit factor in force mode defines a factor the speed limitation is multiplied with.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Speed limit factor in force mode is used in the processes where the material collapses during the squeezing process. For example, during spot welding wire to wire.

By setting Speed limit factor in force mode to a higher value than 1, it is possible to disable or reduce the speed limitation if the material is collapsing at the end of the squeezing process. This will reduce the risk of unintendedly release of the squeezing force.

wrapper.title: Example
wrapper.paragraph: If speed limit 2 = 50 rad/s.
If speed limit factor in force mode = 2.
Then during the force buildup 50 rad/s will be the speed limit that will reduce the torque.
As soon as the force is fully built up, the speed limit will be increased to 100 rad/s to avoid any force reduction if the material is collapsing at a later stage of the process.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Speed limit factor in force mode can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.1 to 10.
The default value is 1.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Speed During Search
Speed During Search belongs to the type Force Master Control , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Speed During Search defines the search speed used in the search process.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: When a spot instruction is using a search argument, the gun will start a movement toward the plate with the speed defined in the parameter Speed During Search .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Speed During Search is only used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.001 and 0.1 m/s.
Default value is 0.05 (50 mm/s).

title.phrase: Prop. Gain in Speed Loop During Search

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Prop. Gain in Speed Loop During Search
Prop. Gain in Speed Loop During Search belongs to the type Force Master Control , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Prop. Gain in Speed Loop During Search is the proportional gain in the speed loop during the search process.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: To be able to have a fixed search tuning of the speed loop a special proportional gain is used in the speed loop. This can in many cases be same value as in the parameter Kv of Lag Control Master , but might in some cases have to be tuned.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Prop. Gain in Speed Loop During Search is only used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.001 and 100.
Default value is 1.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Integration Time in Speed Loop
Integration Time in Speed Loop belongs to the type Force Master Control , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Integration Time in Speed Loop defines the integration time in the speed loop during the search process.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: To be able to have a fixed search tuning of the speed loop an integration time can be used in the speed loop. This can in many cases be same value as in the parameter Ti of Lag Control Master , but might in some cases have to be tuned.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Integration Time in Speed Loop is only used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.1 and 250 Hz.
Default value is 15 Hz.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Friction Compensation , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
Each set of parameters of the type friction compensation, type
Friction Compensation belongs to a joint (robot joint or additional axis).
The parameters in Friction Compensation define what compensations should be made for the friction in the joint.

wrapper.title: Limitation
wrapper.paragraph: Changing the parameter values in Friction Compensation is only useful if you have the RobotWare option Advanced Shape Tuning .

The type Friction Compensation equivalent to the type Control Parameters . The type Control Parameters is used by robot models IRB 1400 and IRB 1410, all other robot models use the type Friction Compensation . The parameters are the same however.

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph:
Application manual Controller software OmniCore
, chapter Advanced Shape Tuning .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Friction Compensation , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Name defines the name of the friction compensation.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Name is only useful if you have the RobotWare option Advanced Shape Tuning.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Friction FFW On belongs to the type Friction Compensation , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Friction FFW On determines if the RobotWare option Advanced Shape Tuning is active or not.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Friction FFW On to Yes if you want to use Advanced Shape Tuning .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Friction FFW On is useful only if you have the RobotWare option Advanced Shape Tuning .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Friction FFW Level belongs to the type Friction Compensation , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Friction FFW Level is set to the level of friction in the robot axis. By setting a value that closely corresponds to the real friction, and using the RobotWare option Advanced Shape Tuning , the friction effects can be compensated.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Friction effects can cause path deviations when performing advanced shapes. By compensating for the friction with the correct friction level value, these effects can be minimized.

Permanent adjustments to the friction level can be made with Friction FFW Level . The friction level can also be temporarily tuned with RAPID commands. For more information, see
Application manual Controller software OmniCore
.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Friction FFW Level is only useful if you have the RobotWare option Advanced Shape Tuning .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A decimal number between 0 and 100 (in Nm).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Friction FFW Ramp belongs to the type Friction Compensation , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Friction FFW Ramp is set to the speed of the robot axis when the friction has reached the constant friction level defined in Friction ffw level . See illustration below.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Friction effects can cause path deviations when performing advanced shapes. Friction FFW Ramp is used when compensating for these friction effects.

Permanent adjustments to the friction ramp can be made with Friction FFW Ramp . The friction ramp can also be temporarily tuned with RAPID commands. For more information, see
Application manual Controller software OmniCore
.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Friction FFW Ramp is only useful if you have the RobotWare option Advanced Shape Tuning .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A number between 0.001 and 10 radians/second.

image.data: align=aleft; angle=0.000; cropped=1; float=0; impang=0.000; impby=Ref; impsize=4.066in 1.997in; nsoffset=0.000in; position=below; sideways=0; xoffset=0.083in; yoffset=0.083in

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Jog Parameters , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
The jog parameters, type
Jog Parameters type contains parameters that define the step size in the different jogging modes when using incremental jogging with user-defined step.

wrapper.title: Incremental movement
wrapper.paragraph: Incremental movement is used to adjust the position of the robot exactly. Each time the joystick is moved, the robot moves one step (one increment).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Jog Parameters , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Name defines the name of the Jog parameters data.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Configurable Linear Step Size (m) belongs to the type Jog Parameters , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Configurable Linear Step Size (m) defines the step size for user-defined incremental linear jogging.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Linear jogging step size is set in meters.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: 0 - 0.005 meters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Configurable Reorient Step Size (rad) belongs to the type Jog Parameters , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Configurable Reorient Step Size (rad) defines the step size for user-defined incremental reorient jogging.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Reorient jogging step size is set in radians.
Convert degrees to radians: radians = (degrees/360)*(2*pi)

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: 0 - 0.009 radians.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Configurable Joint Step Size (rad) belongs to the type Jog Parameters , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Configurable Joint Step Size (rad) defines the step size for user-defined incremental axes jogging.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Axes jogging step size is set in radians.
Convert degrees to radians: radians = (degrees/360)*(2*pi)

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: 0 - 0.0025 radians.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Jog Mode belongs to the type Jog Parameters , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Jog Mode is used to decide the active jogging mode. When the Jog Mode is Responsive the jogging is more responsive than the standard jogging.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: When set to Responsive, the responsive jogging is enabled. For example, the Jog Mode should be set to Standard when World Zones is active.

wrapper.title: Default value
wrapper.paragraph: Default value is Standard. However, Responsive is activated for some robot types.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Joint which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
The joint, type
Joint type contains parameters that define a joint.

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph: The Arm type.
The Measurement Channel.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Joint , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Name defines the unique name to use for this joint.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Logical Axis belongs to the type Joint , in the topic Motion.

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Logical Axis defines the axis number as seen by a RAPID program.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The value of Logical Axis is used by RAPID programs to identify individual axes in mechanical units.
Two mechanical units can have the same value set for Logical Axis , but then they cannot be activated at the same time by a RAPID program.
Robots from ABB normally use the values 1-6, while additional axes use 7-12.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 1 and 12.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Use Drive System belongs to the type Joint , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use Drive System determines which drive system should be used. For more information, see The Drive System.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Use Process belongs to the type Joint , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use Process defines which process to use for this joint.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Use Process points to a process ID defined by the parameter Name in the type Process . For more information, see Name.
The process can be used to define the joints behavior for either Electronically Linked Motors or Spot Servo .

wrapper.title: Prerequisites
wrapper.paragraph: The additional axes must be configured before setting Use Process .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Use Process is only used for additional axes.
Use Process is only useful if you have either of the RobotWare base functionality Electronically Linked Motors or option Spot Servo .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Lock Joint in Ipol belongs to the type Joint , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: A flag that locks the axis so it is not used in the path interpolation.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: When setting Lock Joint in Ipol to Yes, this axis will not be used for path interpolation.
When using Electronically Linked Motors , this parameter must be set to Yes for the follower axis.

wrapper.title: Prerequisites
wrapper.paragraph: The additional axes must be configured before setting Lock Joint in Ipol .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Lock Joint in Ipol is only used for additional axes.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Follower to Joint belongs to the type Joint , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: When using Electronically Linked Motors , Follower to Joint defines which master axis this axis should follow.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: When using Electronically Linked Motors , the follower axis has the Follower to Joint set to the name of the master axis.

wrapper.title: Prerequisites
wrapper.paragraph: The additional axes must be configured before setting Follower to Joint .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Follower to Joint is only used for external axes.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Drive Module Number belongs to the type Joint , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Drive Module Number defines the drive module number that should be used. For more information, see Use Drive Module.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Drive Module Number points to the number in the drive module defined by the parameter Name in the Type Drive Module.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: The Drive Module Number has to be equal to the number in the parameter Use Drive Module in the Type Joint.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 1 and 4.
The default value is 1.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Use Drive Module belongs to the type Joint , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use Drive Module determines which drive module should be used.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Use Drive Module points to a drive module ID defined by the parameter Name in the Type Drive Module. For more information, see Type Drive Module.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: The number in this name has to be equal to the Drive Module Number in the parameter Drive Module Number in the Type Joint.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.
The default value is drive_module_1.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Use Measurement Channel belongs to the type Joint , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use Measurement Channel determines which measurement channel should be used. For more information, see Measurement Channel.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Use Measurement Channel points to a measurement channel ID defined by the parameter Name in the Type Measurement Channel .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Lag Control Master 0 , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of the type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
The type lag control master 0, type
Lag Control Master 0 is normally used for control of axes without any dynamic model. This is the case for some additional axes.
For axes that have a dynamic model, Lag Control Master 0 is only used in exceptional cases.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The name of the Lag Control Master 0 .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Name is used to reference a Lag Control Master 0 from the parameter Normal Control Master in the type Joint .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Kp, Gain Position Loop belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Proportional gain in the position control loop.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The higher the value of Kp, Gain Position Loop , the better tracking and disturbance rejection.
If the position control overshoots, decrease Kp, Gain Position Loop .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 1000 (1/s).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Kv, Gain Speed Loop belongs to the type Lag Control Master , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Proportional gain in the speed regulation loop.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The higher the value of Kv, Gain Speed Loop , the better tracking and disturbance rejection.
If the level of oscillation or noise is too high, decrease Kv, Gain Speed Loop .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 1000 (Nms/rad).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Ti Integration Time Speed Loop belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Integration time in the speed regulation loop.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The lower the value of Ti Integration Time Speed Loop , the better tracking and disturbance rejection.
If the level of oscillation or noise is too high, increase Ti Integration Time Speed Loop .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 10 (seconds).
The default value is 10 seconds.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Forced Control Active belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Determines whether forced control is active for this joint.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The Forced Control Active parameter can be used if the last part of the movement before a fine point is too slow. The function changes the parameters Forced Factor for Kp and Forced Factor for Ki in the last part of the movement. For more information, see Forced Factor for Kp and Forced Factor for Ki.

wrapper.title: Note
wrapper.paragraph: Wrongly used Forced Control Active (too high force factors) might impair the movement with oscillations.
If Forced Control Active is set to Yes, Affects forced ctrl in type Supervision should normally also be set to Yes for this joint. For more information, see Affects Forced Control.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Forced Factor for Kp belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The forced factor for Kp , if forced gain control is active.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Forced Factor for Kp defines the gain increase factor.
A typical value is 2.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 1 and 10.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Forced Factor for Ki belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The forced factor for Ki , if forced gain control is active.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Forced Factor for Ki defines the gain increase factor.
Ki equals Kv/Ti, integral gain.
A typical value is 2.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 1 and 10.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Raise Time for Kp belongs to the type Lag Control Master , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the raise time for forced Kp .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: To avoid transient effects, Kp must be increased slowly over a period of time. This period is defined by Raise Time for Kp .
A typical value is 0.2.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0.002 and 0.5 seconds.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: FFW Mode belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: FFW Mode defines the control type to use, i.e. if feed forward should be used.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: To regulate the position, you can:

listitem.paragraph: use only the desired position as reference.
in addition to the position, use feed forward of the current speed value.
in addition to the position, use feed forward of the current speed and torque values.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: FFW Mode can have the following values:

td.paragraph: The controller is driven by the position error (lag). Because a relatively large lag is needed to move the axis, the position error can be large.

The controller receives information about the desired speed of the axis. As a result, the position lag is greatly reduced compared to the No configuration. For this reason, Spd is the recommended configuration.
The controller uses the desired speed and acceleration of the axis to calculate the desired motor torque.

This requires knowledge of the mass moment of inertia of the axis, which must be supplied by the user. For this reason this configuration is more difficult to tune. It is only recommended for experienced users.

wrapper.paragraph: The default value is 0. Recommended value is 1.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Bandwidth belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the controller bandwidth when FFW Mode is set to 1 or 2. For more information, see FFW Mode.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: A high bandwidth value gives faster control but increases risk of vibrations and overshoot.
The default value is recommended, but can be reduced if undesired vibrations occur.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.5 and 75. The default value is 25.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Df belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Reduces oscillations.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Df can be used to damp oscillations of the axis due to mechanical resonance.

Initially Df should be left at its default value. It can be adjusted once the other controller parameters have been fixed (
Kv, Gain Speed Loop
,
Kp, Gain Position Loop
,
Ti Integration Time Speed Loop
, and
Inertia
).
Df is only used when FFW Mode is set to 2. For more information, see FFW Mode.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 1 and 100. Default value is 100.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Dw belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Can reduce oscillations further when Df is set. For more information, see Df.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The default value of Dw is recommended.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.002 to 1. Default value is 0.01.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Delay belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Reduces overshoot.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Delay can be used when Df is set, to reduce overshoot but it impairs the axis coordination when increased. For more information, see Df.
The default value of Delay should normally not be changed.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.0 and 0.02. Default value is 0.004.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Inertia belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the additional axisâ inertia (if rotation) or mass (if translation).

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Inertia is used for calculating the torque when FFW Mode is set to 2. For more information, see FFW Mode.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.0 and 10,000.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: K Soft Max Factor belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Determines the value of the product Kp Gain Position Loop * Kv Gain Speed Loop when the soft servo is used with softness 0%. For more information, see Kp, Gain Position Loop and Kv, Gain Speed Loop.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: K Soft Max Factor should be in the range 0.1 - 2.0 (default 1.0). When the soft servo is activated with 0% softness, the control parameters Kp Gain Position Loop (Kp) and Kv Gain Speed Loop (Kv) will be tuned such that Kp*Kv = ( Kp*Kv )normal* K Soft Max Factor , where ( Kp*Kv )normal is the product of Kp and Kv during normal operation.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.001 and 1000. Default value is 1.0.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: K Soft Min Factor belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Determines the value of the product Kp Gain Position Loop * Kv Gain Speed Loop if the soft servo is used with softness 100%. For more information, see Kp, Gain Position Loop and Kv, Gain Speed Loop.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: K Soft Min Factor should be in the range 0.001 - 0.1 (default 0.01). When the soft servo is activated with 100% softness, the control parameters Kp Gain Position Loop (Kp) and Kv Gain Speed Loop (Kv) are tuned such that Kp*Kv = ( Kp*Kv )normal* K Soft Min Factor .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.001 and 1000. Default value is 0.01.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Kp/Kv Ratio Factor belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the factor used to tune the Kp Gain Position Loop / Kv Gain Speed Loop ratio. For more information, see Kp, Gain Position Loop and Kv, Gain Speed Loop.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Kp/Kv Ratio Factor is used to alter the Kp Gain Position Loop/Kv Gain Speed Loop ratio during soft servo. Kp/Kv Ratio Factor should be in the range 0.1 - 1.0 (default 1.0). In soft servo mode, Kp and Kv are tuned such that Kp/Kv = ( Kp/Kv )normal * Kp/Kv Ratio Factor .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.001 and 1000.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Ramp Time belongs to the type Lag Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the default Soft Servo ramp time.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Ramp Time is used to define the default time for activation of the soft servo.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.01 and 0.5. Default value is 0.05.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Linked M Process , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of the type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
A linked m process, type
Linked M Process contains information about alignments between the master axis and the follower axis for Electronically Linked Motors .

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph:
Application manual Controller software OmniCore
, chapter Electronically Linked Motors .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Linked M Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Name defines the identity of the linked motor process.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The Name is used when referencing the linked motor process.
The linked motor process defines the behavior of a joint for Electronically Linked Motors .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Offset Adjust. Delay Time belongs to the type Linked M Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Offset Adjust. Delay Time defines the time delay from control on until the follower axis starts to follow its master axis.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: When using Electronically Linked Motors , you might want to give the master axis some time to stabilize before the follower axis starts following.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 20, specifying the delay in seconds.
Default value: 0.2

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Max Follower Offset belongs to the type Linked M Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Max Follower Offset defines the maximum allowed difference in position between the master and the follower axis.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If the follower offset exceeds the Max Follower Offset , emergency stop is activated and automatic offset adjustment is prohibited.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 50, specifying the maximum offset in radians (for rotational axes) or meters (for linear axes) on the arm side.
Default value: 0.05.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Max Offset Speed belongs to the type Linked M Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Max Offset Speed defines the maximum allowed difference in speed between the master and the follower axis.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If the speed difference exceeds the Max Offset Speed , emergency stop is activated and automatic offset adjustment is prohibited.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 1000, specifying the maximum difference in rad/s (for rotational axes) or m/s (for linear axes) on the arm side.
Default value: 0.05.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Offset Speed Ratio belongs to the type Linked M Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Offset Speed Ratio defines how large a part of the Max Offset Speed can be used to compensate for position error. For more information, see Max Offset Speed.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Offset Speed Ratio multiplied by Max Offset Speed is the highest speed by which the position offset is reduced.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 1. The value has no unit since it is a multiplication factor.
Default value: 0.33.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Ramp Time belongs to the type Linked M Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Ramp Time defines the acceleration up to Max Offset Speed . For more information, see Max Offset Speed.

wrapper.title: Usage
Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.01 and 100, specifying the time in seconds.
Default value: 1

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Master Follower Kp belongs to the type Linked M Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Master Follower Kp is the proportion constant for position regulation.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Master Follower Kp determines how fast the position error is compensated. If the value is too low, the compensation will be slow. If the value is to large, the compensation will be unstable.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 5 (unit is 1/s).
Default value: 0.05.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Torque follower belongs to the type Linked M Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Torque follower specifies whether the follower should share torque with master axis rather than regulating to the exact corresponding position.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Torque follower turns on or off the torque follower functionality. If the value is Yes the follower axis will share torque with master axis.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.
Default value is No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Torque quota belongs to the type Linked M Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Torque quota is a quota defining how much of the total torque should be applied by the follower axis.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The follower axis will get its torque reference according to the master axis torque multiplied with the quota.
If motors and gears are identical, it is recommend to set this value a bit lower than 1, for example, 0.95.
This parameter will have no effect if Torque follower is set to No.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 1.
Default value is 1.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Mains , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of the type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
The type mains, type
Mains defines the drive system's mains power tolerance. The parameters of the Mains type have nominal values. For more information, see Mains Tolerance Min., Mains Tolerance Max, and How to optimize drive system parameters.
The parameters of the type Mains can be used to improve the robot's performance by adjusting them according to the robot's actual installation.
Parameter settings outside the range of the robot's installation may negatively affect the robot's performance.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Mains , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Name specifies the name of the mains tolerance setting it belongs to.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Mains Tolerance Min belongs to the type Mains , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Mains Tolerance Min specifies the minimum value of the mains tolerance as a percentage. The value is set to -15% on delivery. If the minimum tolerance is less than 15%, the cycle time can be improved by changing the parameter.
For more information, see How to optimize drive system parameters.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between -1 and +1 (equals -100% and 100%).
The default value is -0.15 (equals -15%).

For single phase 220V systems the default value is specified as 220V -15%. If 230V mains is used and the tolerance is 230V -15% then set the parameter manually to -0.11 (220V -11% is approximately 230V -15%).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Mains Tolerance Max belongs to the type Mains , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Mains Tolerance Max specifies the maximum value of the mains tolerance. Its default value is 0.1 (10%). This value normally should not be increased since the equipment is rated for this maximum mains tolerance and might be damaged if the voltage is increased.

For 220V single phase systems the default value is 0.10 (10%). If 230 V mains is used and the tolerance should be 230 V + 10% then set the parameter manually to 0.15 (220 V + 15% is the same as 230 V + 10%).
For more information, see How to optimize drive system parameters.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is 0.1.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Measurement Channel which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph: Measurement Channel, type The type Measurement Channel describes which position sensor on the SMB to use for a joint.

wrapper.title: Non-editable parameters
wrapper.paragraph: The following parameters are visible but not editable in the software configuration tools:
As a consequence, the above parameters are not described in the manual.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Measurement Channel , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Name defines the name of the used channel.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Disconnect at Deactivate belongs to the type Measurement Channel , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Disconnect at Deactivate shall be set if it the physical signals from position sensor is intended to be disconnected when the mechanical unit is deactivated.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Disconnect at Deactivate to Yes to avoid error reports when the resolver is disconnected, for instance when switching between tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.
Default value is No

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Mechanical Unit which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
The mechanical unit, type
Mechanical Unit type describes the common parameters for a mechanical unit. There is one set of parameters for each mechanical unit.
This type is only possible to edit for additional axes, not for robots delivered from ABB.

wrapper.title: Non-editable parameters
wrapper.paragraph: The following parameter is visible but not editable in the software configuration tools:
As a consequence, the above parameter is not described in the manual.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Mechanical Unit , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Name defines the name for the mechanical unit.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Use Activation Relay belongs to the type Mechanical Unit , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use Activation Relay defines the Id name for the activation relay.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Use Activation Relay points out a relay that will be activated or deactivated when the mechanical unit is activated or deactivated.

More information can be found in
Technical reference manual RAPID Instructions, Functions and Data types
under the instructions ActUnit/DeactUnit .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

phrase.paragraph: RAPID Instructions, Functions and Data types

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Unit has no brake
Unit has no brake belongs to the type Mechanical Unit , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Unit has no brake defines if the mechanical unit has a brake or not.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Unit has no brake to Yes if the mechanical unit has no brake.
The default value is No , that is, that the mechanical unit has a brake.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Use Brake Relay belongs to the type Mechanical Unit , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use Brake Relay defines the Id name for the brake relay.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Use Brake Relay points out what brake relay will be activated or deactivated when the mechanical unit goes to state control on or control off.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Use Connection Relay belongs to the type Mechanical Unit , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use Connection Relay defines the Id name for the connection relay.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Use Connection Relay points out a relay that must be activated when the mechanical unit is activated.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Use Robot belongs to the type Mechanical Unit , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use Robot defines which robot is part of the mechanical unit.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The robot is defined in the type Robot .
For more information, see Name, of the type Robot .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Use Single 1 , Use Single 2 , Use Single 3 , Use Single 4 , Use Single 5 , and Use Single 6 belong to the type Mechanical Unit , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use Single defines which singles are part of the mechanical unit.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph:
The mechanical unit can have six singles,
Use Single 1
,
Use Single 2
,
Use Single 3
,
Use Single 4
,
Use Single 5
, and
Use Single 6
. The singles are defined in the type Single .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Each single is a string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph: Name, in the type Single .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Allow Move of User Frame belongs to the type Mechanical Unit , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Allow Move of User Frame defines if a robot or single is allowed to move a user frame.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: A user frame can be moved by a robot or a single that is part of the mechanical unit. Set Allow Move of User Frame to Yes to allow a robot or single to move a user frame.

Note that the definition of the work object must allow it to be moved, see wobjdata ( ufprog and ufmec ) in
Technical reference manual RAPID Instructions, Functions and Data types
.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

phrase.paragraph: RAPID Instructions, Functions and Data types

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Activate at Start Up belongs to the type Mechanical Unit , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Activate at Start Up defines if the mechanical unit should be activated at start.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set the value to Yes to activate the mechanical unit at start.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No .
The default value is No .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Deactivation Forbidden belongs to the type Mechanical Unit , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Deactivation Forbidden defines if the mechanical unit is allowed to be deactivated.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Deactivation Forbidden to Yes if the mechanical unit should be allowed to be deactivated. They should not be deactivated.
The value No is used only for additional axes that should be possible to deactivate.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.
The default value for ABB robots is Yes.
The default value is No in case a new external axis is added manually.

section.data: option=Tool Control, Servo Tool Change;optionRW7=Tool Control, Servo Tool Change;

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Deactivate PTC superv. at disconnect belongs to the type Mechanical Unit , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Set the parameter Deactivate PTC superv. at disconnect to Yes, to disable the PTC supervision when the mechanical unit is disconnected and enabled again when it is activated.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The PTC supervision is used to detect high motor temperatures for mechanical units. If a unit is physically disconnected while the PTC supervision is active, an error will occur.

When using Servo Tool Change, it must be possible to disconnect the servo tool. By setting Deactivate PTC superv. at disconnect to Yes , the servo tool can be deactivated and removed without an error. When the new tool is connected and activated, PTC supervision is activated again.

wrapper.title: Prerequisites
wrapper.paragraph: Setting Deactivate PTC superv. at disconnect to Yes is only useful if an additional axis is disconnected without turning off the robot system. This can only be done if you have the options Tool Control and Servo Tool Change .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: If Deactivate PTC superv. at disconnect is set to Yes and the mechanical unit is deactivated, the PTC supervision is disabled for all additional axes in the system (but not for the robot).

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Activate from any motion task belongs to the type Mechanical Unit , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: If Activate from any motion task is set to Yes, the mechanical unit can be deactivated by one task and then activated by another motion task. The mechanical unit is then controlled by the task that has activated it.

In other words, if the Activate from any motion task parameter is active, a mechanical unit can be moved between different motion tasks. Both the motion control and the RAPID execution for this unit will be moved to the other task.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If Activate from any motion task is set to Yes, a mechanical unit, for example a servo gun, can be used by two robots in a MultiMove system.

wrapper.title: Example
wrapper.paragraph: A servo gun is held by robot 1 and controlled by the task T_ROB1. It is deactivated and disconnected from robot 1. The servo gun is then connected to robot 2 and activated by the task T_ROB2.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Deactivation Forbidden must be set to No for this mechanical unit. Activate from any motion task can only be used for a mechanical unit that can be deactivated, that is not for a robot.
Activate from any motion task is only useful for a MultiMove system.

It is only supported to deactivate a mechanical unit from the same motion task as it was activated. This task controls the mechanical unit and can secure that it is standing still before deactivating it. When the mechanical unit has been deactivated, it can be activated in another motion task. The new task will then control the unit. It is important to remember that the two mechanical units with a common logical axis number cannot be active at the same time in a Rapid task, for more information see Logical Axis.
The mechanical unit must still belong to a mechanical unit group, see Type Mechanical Unit Group. This configuration determines which task that will control the mechanical unit at start.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The default value is No.

wrapper.title: Additional information
wrapper.paragraph: If the program pointer is moved to main, the mechanical unit regains its configuration from the system parameters, that is it is activated by its original task. Make sure the program is not restarted from main with the mechanical unit mounted on another robot than configured in the system parameters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Act/Deact Only from Rapid
Act/Deact Only from Rapid belongs to the type Mechanical Unit , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Act/Deact Only from Rapid defines if activation and deactivation of a mechanical unit shall only be allowed from RAPID, that is, the activation state for a mechanical unit shall not change when the RAPID program pointer is moved.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Act/Deact Only from Rapid when the activation state shall not be changed when the RAPID program pointer is moved.
The value Yes is only used for additional axes.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.
Default value is No.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Motion Planner , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of the type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

When several task programs are run in synchronized mode, the movements of all their mechanical unit groups are calculated by the same motion planner. It is then the first set of parameters of the type Motion Planner that is used.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
A
Motion Planner, type motion planner is a process on the controller that calculates how mechanical units shall move. A controller that handles more than one robot also has more than one motion planner. Each mechanical unit group has its own motion planner.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Unless the option MultiMove is installed, there can only be one motion planner configuration.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The name of the motion planner.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: This is the public identity of the motion planner. It is used by the parameter Use Motion Planner in the type Mechanical Unit Group . For more information, see The Mechanical Unit Group type in the topic Controller .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.
The name must not be changed.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: AbsAcc Speed Adjust belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter AbsAcc Speed Adjust makes a robot with AbsAcc, follow the path with the same speed as the corresponding nominal robot. The path based on the the AbsAcc adjusted target, can be longer or shorter than the nominal path, thus results in a different cycle time.
When the parameter is set to Yes , the cycle time for a nominal robot and for AbsAcc calibrated robots is much the same.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No .
The default value is Yes .

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph:
Application manual Controller software OmniCore
, chapter Motion performance.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: TCP Linear Max Speed (m/s) belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: It defines the maximum linear speed (m/s) in RAPID speeddata vmax and that is possible to set in RAPID speeddata for a TCP-robot.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter is used to define v_tcp in RAPID speeddata vmax. If a higher value than this is used in a user defined speeddata it will be limited to this value.
For more information, see TCP Reorient Max Speed, Ext. Axis Rotational Max Speed, and Ext. Axis Linear Max Speed.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.01 and 339.
The default value is 7.

phrase.paragraph: RAPID Instructions, Functions and Data types

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: TCP Reorient Max Speed (m/s) belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: It defines the maximum reorientation speed (deg/s) in RAPID speeddata vmax.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter is used to define v_ori in RAPID speeddata vmax. For more information, see TCP Linear Max Speed, Ext. Axis Linear Max Speed, and Ext. Axis Rotational Max Speed.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.01 and 100000.
The default value is 500.

phrase.paragraph: RAPID Instructions, Functions and Data types

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Ext. Axis Linear Max Speed (m/s) belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: It defines the maximum external axis linear speed (m/s) in RAPID speeddata vmax.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter is used to define v_leax in RAPID speeddata vmax. For more information, see TCP Linear Max Speed, TCP Reorient Max Speed, and Ext. Axis Rotational Max Speed.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.01 and 339.
The default value is 5.

phrase.paragraph: RAPID Instructions, Functions and Data types

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Ext. Axis Rotational Max Speed (deg/s) belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: It defines the maximum external axis reorientation speed (deg/s) in RAPID speeddata vmax.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter is used to define v_reax in RAPID speeddata vmax. For more information, see TCP Linear Max Speed, TCP Reorient Max Speed, and Ext. Axis Linear Max Speed.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.01 and 100000.
The default value is 1000.

phrase.paragraph: RAPID Instructions, Functions and Data types

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Brake on Time belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Brake on Time is used to delay the use of brakes when the robot is waiting to move. It defines the time from when the robot stops to when the mechanical brakes are activated.
The brake on time value should be kept high to maintain the reliability of the servo at high level.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: It is necessary that all Mechanical Units in the system has a Use Brake Relay defined, else this parameter will have no effect.

Values for Brake On Timeout will only be considered for Motion Planners with configured Mechanical Units. This means that for systems without any MultiMove option, it will only be necessary to set Brake On Timeout for Motion Planner 1. For MultiMove systems, different values for Brake On Timeout can be set and all Motion Planners with configured Mechanical Units must agree that the system should apply the brakes before an order to apply the brakes is executed.
For more information, see Use Brake Relay.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.3 to 3,600,000, specifying the time in seconds.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Dynamic Resolution belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Dynamic Resolution is optimized for the system at delivery. It should normally not be changed.
The dynamic resolution can be reduced from the nominal value 1.0, which reduces the cycle time in some applications. However, a lower dynamic resolution will increase the CPU load.

wrapper.title: Limitation
wrapper.paragraph: Dynamic Resolution is optimized for the system at delivery. It should normally not be changed.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.1667 to 1.00, specifying a factor of the resolution.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Path Resolution belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter is used for specific applications such as conveyer tracking or synchronization with press equipment.

wrapper.title: Prerequisites
wrapper.paragraph: It is important to set the path resolution value as low as possible in order to achieve a high path resolution at high speed. Keeping the path resolution low can also give shorter cycle times if the cycle contains many stop points and the move instructions following these stop points have low speeds.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Path Resolution might require tuning when:

listitem.paragraph: Using coordinated interpolation.
Using Weldguide.
Using the option Conveyor Tracking .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.1667 to 6.00, specifying a factor of the resolution.

wrapper.title: Additional information
wrapper.paragraph: There is also a RAPID instruction named PathResol which affects the resolution of the path.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Queue Time belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Increasing Queue Time makes the system more tolerant to uneven CPU loads.

The real queue time is a multiple of a sample time related to dynamic resolution. If the parameter value is not an even multiple of the dynamic resolution, the controller will automatically use a queue time as close as possible to the given value.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.004032 to 0.290304, specifying the time in seconds.

wrapper.title: Additional information
wrapper.paragraph: A drawback with increasing the queue time is that the robot reacts more slowly when jogging and when stopping a program execution. However, the emergency brake is not affected. The accuracy of a sensor process, e.g. WeldGuide and Conveyor tracking, may also be affected.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Teach Mode Max Speed belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Teach Mode Max Speed can be used to set the maximum TCP-speed in manual mode to less than the default value 0.25 m/s.
When the value of this parameter is reduced, the maximum joint speed in teach mode will also be reduced.
If the value is set to 0.2 m/s, all maximum joint speeds in teach mode will be reduced by 0.2/0.25=0.8, i.e. 80% of the previous values.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.010 to 0.250, specifying the speed in meter per seconds.
The default value is 0.25 m/s.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Process Update Time belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Process Update Time determines how often the process path information is calculated. This information is used for path following in Conveyor tracking, WeldGuide and Rapid Weave, for example.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Decreasing the process update time improves accuracy but also increases CPU load. Increasing the parameter decreases the CPU load.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: When running programs in which the manipulator is moving at high speed, the parameter value should be kept small in order to get the best performance. When the manipulator is moving slowly, the process update time is not critical.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.012096 to 1.93536, specifying the time in seconds.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Prefetch Time belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Prefetch Time affects the point in time at which the controller starts to plan for the motion through a corner zone. If the planning time is too short, the corner zone becomes a fine point. This generates a warning calledâ 50024 Corner path failureâ.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If the planning time is too short because of high CPU load, increasing the parameter value may solve the problem. However, it will not solve the problem when it is caused by too many corner zones placed very close together or by incorrect use of instructions, e.g. a corner zone followed by a WaitDI instruction. Normally, Prefetch Time should only be increased when the corner zone is really needed in the application. When it is not really needed, change the corner zone to a fine point.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: There is a drawback when increasing the parameter. The difference between the position of the executed RAPID instruction and the current position of the manipulator will increase. This means that after pressing stop during program execution, the program counter on the FlexPendant may show an instruction that has not yet affected the manipulator. When starting again, the manipulator continues along the original path.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 to 10, specifying the time in seconds.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Event Preset Time belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Event Preset Time is used to delay the robot to make it possible to activate/control external equipment in advance. This is to compensate for the internal delay of the equipment.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Adjustment for the internal delay of the equipment can be made with the instruction TriggEquip . This takes advantage of the delay between the RAPID commands and the robot movement. In this way an output signal can be set up to about 100 ms in advance. If the delay of the equipment is longer than 100 ms, then Event Preset Time must be used to increase the delay of the robot movement.
Configure Event Preset Time to the longest equipment delay time needed (if more than 100ms).

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 0.5, specifying the time in seconds.

wrapper.title: Additional information
wrapper.paragraph: Remember that when using Event Preset Time , the start of the robot is delayed and the performance of WeldGuide, conveyors, spot welding, and so on will be decreased.
If Event Preset Time is defined, the system input Limit Speed should not be used. The actions that need the Event Preset Time may be handled incorrectly when the Limit Speed signal is set.

wrapper.title: Example
wrapper.paragraph: If you use Fixed Position Event with the following RAPID instructions, you should configure Event Preset Time to 0.2 seconds (the maximum delay required by TriggEquip)

paragraph.phrase: TriggL p1, v500, gunon, z50, gun1;

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Restrict Placing of Circlepoints belongs to the type Motion Planner , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Restrict Placing of Circlepoints adds a supervision that the circle path not turns around more than 240 degrees and that the circle point is placed in the middle part of the circle path.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If the program is started on a MoveC instruction and the robot is standing between the circle point and the end point then there is a risk that the robot will perform the circle backwards.
