wrapper.paragraph: A value between -6.283186 and 6.283186 radians.
Default values is 0.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Arm Check Point Speed Limit belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Arm Check Point Speed Limit sets the speed limit in meter per second for the arm check point (ACP).
Cartesian speed supervision This parameter is used to configure the safety function Cartesian speed supervision.

When changing this safety related system parameter, an event message will take focus on the FlexPendant after restart to notify the user of the change. The user then has to verify that the intended setting was made.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Arm Check Point Speed Limit is only used for the following robots:
Setting this parameter for any other robot will not have any effect.
Arm Check Point Speed Limit can only be used to lower the speed limit from a maximum speed limit for each robot type. If a higher value is set, the maximum value for the robot type is used.
The maximum value for the robot types are:

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A number between 0.1 and 20.
The default value is 0.75.

title.phrase: Upper Work Area x, y, z

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Upper Work Area x , Upper Work Area y , and Upper Work Area z belong to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Upper work area x defines the x-coordinate of the upper bound of the work area for the robot.
Upper work area y defines the y-coordinate of the upper bound of the work area for the robot.
Upper work area z defines the z-coordinate of the upper bound of the work area for the robot.
For more information, see How to restrict the work area for parallel arm robots and How to define base frame.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: This parameter is valid only for parallel arm robots.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value higher than the respective Lower Work Area value in meters. For more information, see Lower Work Area x, y, z.

title.phrase: Lower Work Area x, y, z

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Lower Work Area x , Lower Work Area y , and Lower Work Area z belong to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Lower work area x defines the x-coordinate of the lower bound of the work area for the robot.
Lower work area y defines the y-coordinate of the lower bound of the work area for the robot.
Lower work area z defines the z-coordinate of the lower bound of the work area for the robot.
For more information, see How to restrict the work area for parallel arm robots and How to define base frame.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: This parameter is valid only for parallel arm robots.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value lower than the respective Upper Work Area value in meters. For more information, see Upper Work Area x, y, z.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Use Motion Process Mode belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use Motion Process Mode defines the choice of motion process mode that is used for the robot. For more information, see Use Motion Process Mode.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

title.phrase: Upper Check Point Bound x, y, z

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Upper Check Point Bound x , Upper Check Point Bound y , and Upper Check Point Bound z belong to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Upper Check Point Bound x defines the cartesian x-coordinate upper check point bound on arm check point.
Upper Check Point Bound y defines the cartesian y-coordinate upper check point bound on arm check point.
Upper Check Point Bound z defines the cartesian z-coordinate upper check point bound on arm check point.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The arm check point can be bound to restrict the movement area. For more information, see How to define arm check point.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value higher than the respective coordinate Lower Check Point Bound in meters. For more information, see Lower Checkpoint Bound x, y, z.

title.phrase: Lower Check Point Bound x, y, z

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Lower Check Point Bound x , Lower Check Point Bound y , and Lower Check Point Bound z belong to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Lower Check Point Bound x defines the cartesian x-coordinate lower check point bound on arm check point.
Lower Check Point Bound y defines the cartesian y-coordinate lower check point bound on arm check point.
Lower Check Point Bound z defines the cartesian z-coordinate lower check point bound on arm check point.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The arm check point can be bound to restrict the movement area. For more information, see How to define arm check point.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value lower than the respective coordinate Upper Check Point Bound in meters. For more information, see Upper Checkpoint Bound x, y, z.

title.phrase: Check Point Bound Limit Outside Cube

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Check Point Bound Limit Outside Cube belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Check Point Bound Limit Outside Cube determines if the robot should be limited to stay outside or inside the cube.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The check point can be restricted to stay outside or inside a defined cube when the robot is moving. The cube is defined and supervised in robot base coordinates, by an upper and a lower coordinate (or corner). Thus, the defined cube will work as a stationary world zone, where the inside or outside of the cube is the forbidden area for the arm check point.

For applications with a 7th axis, the base frame of the robot could be moved by the 7th axis. This will pose a limitation on using arm check points for avoiding fixed objects along the direction of the additional axis.
If the parameter is Yes , then the check point is limited to stay outside the cube. If the parameter is No , then the check point is limited to stay inside the cube.

wrapper.title: Prerequisites
wrapper.paragraph: The arm check point bounds must be configured before setting Check Point Bound Limit Outside Cube . For more information, see How to define arm check point.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Check Point Bound Limit Outside Cube can only be used for articulated robots.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No .

wrapper.title: Default value
wrapper.paragraph: Default value is No , limited to stay outside the cube.

paragraph.link: Upper Check Point Bound x, y, z_en.xml
Lower Check Point Bound x, y, z_en.xml

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Track Conveyor with Robot belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines if the robot should track the conveyor.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Track Conveyor with Robot to Yes if the robot should track the conveyor without using the track axis, even if robot is coordinated with track. Default value is No.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Track Conveyor with Robot can only be used with option Conveyor tracking installed.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Max External Pos Adjustment belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Max External Pos Adjustment defines the maximum position adjustment allowed in conveyor direction while tracking a conveyor. The unit is meter.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If error 50163 occurs, the value of this parameter can be increased for the robots with heavy load and high conveyor speed. Before increasing the parameter value, verify that the parameters Adjustment speed and Adjustment accel (type Conveyor systems in the topic Process ) are correctly defined.
If the value of this parameter is increased, the value of the parameters Start ramp and Stop ramp parameters should also be increased to 20 or 30 (type Conveyor systems in the topic Process ).

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.1 and 0.8.
The default value is 0.2.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Time to Inposition belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Time to Inposition defines the delay time between the last position reference and the inposition event when reaching a fine point.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Time to Inposition is only used by the option Conveyor tracking .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 2.0 seconds.
Default value is 0.08 seconds. This should not be changed.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Orientation Supervision Off belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The Orientation Supervision Off system parameter defines whether the orientation supervision is Off or On. The parameter is valid only for IRB 340 and IRB 360.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The orientation supervision is normally On and hence the value of the Orientation Supervision Off system parameter is noramlly No. If the orientation supervision is triggered in a system and if the system was working in a previous release of RobotWare, the supervision can be switched off by setting the value of Orientation Supervision Off system parameter to Yes.

Note! Switching off the orientation supervision can cause an incorrect behavior in the tool orientation of the robot. The supervision is triggered due to an error in the RAPID program and the first action to be taken is to correct the error rather than switching off the orientation supervision.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Mech.Unit Not Moving Detection Level belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Mech.Unit Not Moving Detection Level defines the detection level for the axes of a Robot for the system output Mechanical Unit Not Moving . For more information, see Mechanical Unit Not Moving and Mech.Unit Not Moving Detection Level.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Normally the output of Mechanical Unit Not Moving will be set only when the robot is stopped. The output will also be set if the speed of all axes of the robot are lower than the defined level.
If the detection level is set both for a robot and a single running in the same motion group, all the axes of the robot and the single must move slower than its level to set the output.

Mechanical units with the detection level defined as 0 can run at high speed also when the output is set. For example, if a robot with a track motion has the detection level defined with a value other than 0 only for the track and the robot axis 1, then the other axes of the robot (with detection level = 0) can run at high speed when the output is set.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 1.
0.01 = 1% of motor max speed, disabled if 0.
The default value is 0.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: LoadIdentify test-speed belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: LoadIdentify test-speed determines the Load Identification speed during the slow test.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: This factor can be used to increase or decrease the axis speed used during the slow-test sequence.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 1 and 6.
The default value is 4, meaning the axis speed will be four times faster than the slowest movement used during the real load identification sequence.

title.phrase: Encoder high temp shall generate error

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Encoder high temp shall generate error belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines if encoder high temperature shall stop the robot and generate an error in the event log.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: When this parameter is:
Set to Yes, the robot stops and an error is reported in the event log.
Set to No, there is only warning report in the event log.
Changing the parameter to No can result in overheated motors.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Global Speed Limit belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Global Speed Limit sets the speed limit in meters per second for the tool center point (TCP), the arm check point (ACP), and the wrist center point (WCP).
Cartesian speed supervision This parameter is used to configure the safety function Cartesian speed supervision.

When changing this safety related system parameter, an event message will take focus on the FlexPendant after restart to notify the user of the change. The user then has to verify that the intended setting was made.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Global Speed Limit is only used for the following robots:
Setting this parameter for any other robot will not have any effect.
Global Speed Limit can only be used to lower the speed limit from maximum speed limit for each robot type. If a higher value is set, the maximum value for the robot type is used.
The maximum value for the robot types are:

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A number between 0.1 and 20.
The default value is 20.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Arm-Angle Reference Direction belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Arm-Angle Reference Direction controls how the arm-angle property is calculated and affects the location of certain singularities for seven-axis robots.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: In addition to position and orientation, seven-axis robots also depend on the arm-angle concept to fully specify a robtarget .

The calculation of the arm-angle depends on a chosen reference direction, and by default this reference direction is chosen as the line passing through axis 2 origin of the robot and being parallel with the Y-axis of the world frame. When the WCP is on the axis chosen as the reference direction, the arm-angle becomes undefined. Hence, the inverse kinematics is singular for all positions with the WCP on the line, and linear movement on and across this line will not work.

If linear movement in this area of the workspace is important for your application, then you can configure the robot to use another reference direction. The choices available are: the world Y-axis, the world Z-axis, and the line passing through axis 1 of the robot.
A RAPID program created with one value for this parameter will behave differently or maybe not work at all if the parameter value is changed.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Arm-Angle Reference Direction can have the following values:

td.paragraph: Reference direction parallel with the Y-axis of the world frame.
Reference direction parallel with the Z-axis of the world frame.
Reference direction parallel with a line passing through axis 1 of the robot.

wrapper.paragraph: The default value is 0.

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph: Product manual for the robot.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Limit avoidance distance belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Limit avoidance distance controls the distance to the nearest singularity or joint limit when automatically adjusting the arm-angle.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The singularities that can be handled are where axis 2 or axis 5 is equal to zero.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between -1 to 100 radians.
The default value is 0.017453 radians.
Setting a negative value will disable the functionality.

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph: Product manual for the robot.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Friction comp. lead through factor belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Friction comp. lead through factor determines how soft a robot should be in lead through mode.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: A higher value makes the robot softer in lead through mode and a lower value makes the robot less soft.
Setting a high value can make the robot sensitive to errors such as wrong payload in the tool definition. The robot can then start to drift by itself.
Setting the value to 0 removes all friction compensation in lead through mode.
This parameter does not need a reboot to apply the changes. Hence the tests of different levels can be done directly after changing the parameter value.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Friction comp. lead through factor is only used for the following robots:
Configuring this parameter in any other robot will not have any effect.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.0 and 1.0.
Default value is 0.6.

title.phrase: Use cfx in robtargets for P-rod robots

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Use cfx in robtargets for P-rod robots
Use cfx in robtargets for P-rod robots belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Use cfx in robtargets for P-rod robots can be used to enable use of configuration cfx in the axis configuration definition on parallel rod robots.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Use cfx in robtargets for P-rod robots to Yes to have the same configuration data as serial link robots.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.
Default value is Yes.

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph:
See the datatype confdata ,
Technical reference manual RAPID Instructions, Functions and Data types
.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Lead through stiffness scale
Lead through stiffness scale belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Lead through stiffness scale can be used to tune the overall lead-through stiffness experience.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Decreasing the value of Lead through stiffness scale will make the lead-through movement more fluid but more sensitive to speed supervision.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Lead through stiffness scale is only used for the following robots:
Setting this parameter for any other robot will not have any effect.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.01 and 1.
Default value 1.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Lead through load compensation
Lead through load compensation belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Lead through load compensation is used to determine the type of load compensation during lead through.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If the value is Default , the load compensation is based on the torques measured during activation of lead through.

If the value is Always , the load compensation is continuously updated based on the measured joint torques. This mode can be used to minimize drift caused by cables and other disturbances affecting the robot arm. The parameter Lead through load compensation deadband in the type Arm can be used to tune the behavior for each robot joint.

If the value is Never , no load compensation is used. The delay when activating lead through is minimized, but the robot becomes more sensitive to drift caused by calibration errors and incorrectly defined loads.
This parameter does not need a restart of the controller to apply the changes. Hence, it is possible to test directly after changing the parameter value.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Lead through load compensation is only used for the following robots:
Setting this parameter for any other robot will not have any effect.
The parameter is only used when Lead-through Mode is set to Axis 1-6 .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Default, Always, or Never.
Default value is Default.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Enable orientation correction
Enable orientation correction belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Enable orientation correction is used to correct the orientation of a 5-axis delta robot, to make it possible to reach positions that are hard to program, for example, inside boxes or bins.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Setting the value to Yes will allow the robot to use internal correction so that it can reach a pose, even if the programmed orientation cannot be reached with a 5-axis robot.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Enable orientation correction is only used for 5-axis delta robots.
Setting this parameter for any other robot will not have any effect.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No
Default value is No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Robot weight in power sharing
Robot weight in power sharing belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Robot weight in power sharing is used to decide how power should be distributed between robots and singles in case the power supply is a limiting factor.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If a movement with both a robot and a positioner needs to be limited due to power supply then the robot's part of the total power will be decided by this parameter.
If robot performance is prioritized then Robot weight in power sharing should be increased and vice versa if single performance is preferred.

wrapper.title: Example 1
wrapper.paragraph: If the power supply has 10 kW with a robot on a track motion and the total required power for a movement would be, for the robot 10 kW and track 2 kW. Then the parameters can be set as follows:

listitem.paragraph: Robot weight in power sharing : 80
Single weight in power sharing : 20

wrapper.paragraph: In this case the distribution of the available power would be 8 kW for robot and 2 kW for track.

wrapper.title: Example 2
wrapper.paragraph: If the power supply has 10 kW with a robot with 3 additional axis and the total required power for a movement would be, for the robot 10 kW and for each single 2 kW. Then the
parameters can be set as follows:

listitem.paragraph: Robot weight in power sharing : 90
Single weight in power sharing : 10

wrapper.paragraph: Then actual sharing for each unit would be:
In this case, the distribution of the available power would be 7.5 kW for robot and 0.83 kW for each single.
Note that 0.83 kW might not be enough and another single weight should be considered.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 1000000.
Default value is 90.

wrapper.title: Additional information
wrapper.paragraph: This parameter does not need a restart of the controller to apply the changes. Hence, it is possible to test directly after changing the parameter value.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Ultra Accuracy belongs to the type Robot , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Ultra Accuracy enables the ultra accuracy mode for GoFa CRB 15000.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Setting the value to Active will make robot run with ultra accuracy mode.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: The ultra accuracy mode is only used for GoFa CRB 15000 and requires the option 3101-10.
Setting this parameter for any other robot will not have any effect.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Active or Inactive .
The default value is Inactive .

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Robot Serial Number , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
The type robot serial number, type
Robot Serial Number contains parameters that define the robotâs serial number.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Robot Serial Number , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Name specifies the name of the robot that the serial number belongs to.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Robot Serial Number High Part belongs to the type Robot Serial Number , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Robot Serial Number High Part defines the high part of the robotâs serial number.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The high part is the first four characters of the serial number.
The serial number can be found on the robotâs identification plate.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum four characters.
Default value is 0000.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Robot Serial Number Low Part belongs to the type Robot Serial Number , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Robot Serial Number Low Part defines the low part of the robotâs serial number.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The low integer part of the serial number.
The serial number can be found on the robotâs identification plate.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: An integer value with maximum nine digits.
Default value is 0.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type SG Process , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of the type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
The type SG process, type
SG Process contains parameters to configure the behavior of a servo gun (or other servo tool). There are parameters for adjusting the timing, force and thickness when closing and opening a servo gun. It is also possible to specify how the tip wear calibration will be performed. The relation between tip force and motor torque is configured as shown below.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: SG Process can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Force-torque relation
wrapper.paragraph: Tip Force 1-5 and Motor Torque 1-5 are used to define the motor torque the motor should apply when a gun closing is ordered with a certain tip force. Due to friction, the relation between force and torque is not always linear.
Between 2 and 5 points can be used to define the motor torque as a function of the tip force. The number of points used is defined in Number of Stored Forces .

When calculating the force-torque function, the origin (force=0, torque=0) is considered to be an extra point in the diagram. For tip force values between points, linear interpolation is used. For tip force values higher than the highest defined tip force, extrapolation from the last two points is used.

wrapper.title: Example
wrapper.paragraph: In this example, four points are used to define the relation between tip force and motor torque.
These parameters and values are configured:
The results of this configuration is the following graph for motor torque as function of tip force:

image.data: align=aleft; angle=0.000; cropped=1; float=0; impang=0.000; impby=Ref; impsize=4.500in 1.719in; nsoffset=0.000in; position=below; sideways=0; xoffset=0.000in; yoffset=0.000in

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The name of the SG Process .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Name is used to reference a SG Process from the parameter Use SG Process in the type Process .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Serial Number belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: This is an identification label or serial number that can be used by the manufacturer to identify each servo gun.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Use Force Master belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use Force Master determines which Force Master should be used. For more information, see The Force Master type.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Use Force Master is a reference to the parameter Name in the type Force Master .

wrapper.title: Prerequisites
wrapper.paragraph: A Force Master must be configured before Use Force Master can refer to it.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Use Force Master can only be used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Close Time Adjust. belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Adjustment of the ordered minimum close time of the gun.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If the servo gun is ordered to start closing before the robot is in position, the tips might touch the work piece too early. By setting Close Time Adjust. to a positive value, this can be avoided.
If there is a waiting period when the robot is in position but before the servo gun is closing, the cycle time can be reduced by setting Close Time Adjust. to a negative value.
Close Time Adjust. may be used to delay the closing slightly when the synchronized pre closing is used for welding.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Close Time Adjust. can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Numerical value between -100 and 100 (seconds).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Close Position Adjust. belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Adjustment of the ordered position when closing the gun to a position and force.

When the tool tips reach the position (plate thickness) ordered by the close instruction, the force control starts. This tool tip position can be adjusted with Close Position Adjust. to make the force control start earlier.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: To make sure the tool tips do not touch the work piece before the force control starts, Close Position Adjust. can be used to leave some space between the tool tips and the work object.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Close Position Adjust. can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Numeric value between 0 and 0.005 (meters).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Force Ready Delay belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Force Ready Delay is used to delay the close ready event. This will make the servo gun wait some extra time when the closing is finished and the ordered force is achieved.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Force Ready Delay can be used if the servo gun needs some extra time for the force to be stabilized.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Force Ready Delay can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 30 (seconds).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Max Force Control Motor Torque belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Max allowed motor torque for force control. Commanded force will be reduced, if the required motor torque is higher than this value.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Max Force Control Motor Torque is used to protect the gun from mechanical overload.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Max Force Control Motor Torque can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 100 (Nm).
The default value is 7.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Post-synchronization Time belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Post-synchronization Time is used to anticipate the open ready event. The open instruction will be considered ready before the servo gun is completely open.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Post-synchronization Time can be used to save cycle time. The waiting time between the opening of the servo gun and the execution of the next instruction can be reduced.
The synchronization may fail if Post-synchronization Time is set too high.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Post-synchronization Time can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 0.5 (seconds).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration Mode belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Number of tip wear calibration points, i.e. the number of times the servo gun closes during a tip wear calibration.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If the flexibility of a servo gun is not linearly dependent of the force, more than two measurement points may be necessary. This will improve the plate thickness detection.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration Mode can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: An integer between 2 and 10.
The default value is 2.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration Force High belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The force used for the last closing when calibrating the tip wear of a servo gun.
Calibration Force High affects the gun stiffness calibration.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Calibration Force High to a value close to the highest force you intend to use the servo gun for. This way it will be well calibrated for forces of that size.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration Force High can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 12000 (N).
The default value is 3500.

wrapper.title: Additional information
wrapper.paragraph: The force of the first gun closing in a tip wear calibration is specified in Calibration Force Low . If more than two measurement points are used, the force of these measurement points are evenly distributed between Calibration Force Low and Calibration Force High .

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration Force Low belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The force used for:

listitem.paragraph: the second gun closing of a new tips calibration
the second gun closing of a tool change calibration
the first gun closing of a tip wear calibration.

wrapper.paragraph: Calibration Force Low affects the gun position calibration.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: It is recommended to set Calibration Force Low to a value close to the lowest force you intend to use the servo gun for, but not a higher value than half the value of Calibration Force High .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration Force Low can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 12000 (N).
The default value is 1500.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration Time belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The time that the servo gun waits in closed position during calibration.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If the servo gun needs more time to stabilize, Calibration Time can be increased. This can improve the gun position calibration.
In order to make the calibrations faster, Calibration Time can be decreased.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration Time can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 30 (seconds).
The default value is 0.5.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Calibration High Force Priority
Calibration High Force Priority belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration High Force Priority defines if the high force in the calibration sequence is prioritized. This will make the calibration start with the higher force.
In combination with Calibration Full Sequence Freq. , it is possible to choose only the high force in the sequence.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set to YES to have the high force have priority

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration High Force Priority can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.
Default value is No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Calibration Full Sequence Freq.
Calibration Full Sequence Freq. belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration Full Sequence Freq. is used to set how often the gun should use multiple closing at calibration.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: It is recommended to set Calibration Force Low to a value close to the lowest force you intend to use the servo gun for, but not a higher value than half the value of Calibration Force High .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration Full Sequence Freq. can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 1000.
0 means gun will always close with a single closing except for the first closing after a tip change.
1 means gun will always close with a multiple closing always.
2 means gun will always close with a multiple every second time.
3 means gun will always close with a multiple every third time, etc.
Default value is 1.

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration Force High and Calibration Force Low.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Calibration No Pos Update
Calibration No Pos Update belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration No Pos Update will prevent the axis position of the gun to be updated at servo tool calibrations. As a consequence, opened gun arm locations are not affected by tip wear changes. On the other hand, gun closing distances increases with tip wear growth.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set to YES to prevent update of gun position.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Calibration No Pos Update can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.
Default value is No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Number of Stored Forces belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Used to define the relation between tip force and motor torque for a servo gun. Number of Stored Forces defines for how many tip force values you want to define the motor torque, i.e. the number of points in the force-torque graph (see Force-torque relation).

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Measure the tip force and motor torque for a number of points. Set Number of Stored Forces to the number of points you want to specify.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Number of Stored Forces can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: An integer between 2 and 10.
The default value is 3.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Soft Stop Timeout belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: If a soft stop occurs during constant force, Soft Stop Timeout defines how long the force will be maintained. The force will be reduced after this time-out, or when opening is commanded.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If you want the gun to remain closed a short period after a soft stop, set Soft Stop Timeout to the desired time-out value.
Setting Soft Stop Timeout to 0 will make the gun release its force immediately when a soft stop occurs.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Soft Stop Timeout can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 100000 (seconds).
The default value is 0.3.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Brake release delay belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Servo Tool independent restart movement will be delayed until this time has passed after control on.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Brake release delay to the desired delay value.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Brake release delay can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 100000 (seconds).
The default value is 0.1.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Tip Force 1 , Tip Force 2 , Tip Force 3 , Tip Force 4 , and Tip Force 5 belong to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Used to define the relation between tip force and motor torque for a servo gun (see Force-torque relation).
Tip Force 1 defines the ordered closing force for the first point in the force-torque graph.
Tip Force 2 defines the ordered closing force for the second point in the force-torque graph.
Tip Force 3 defines the ordered closing force for the third point in the force-torque graph.
Tip Force 4 defines the ordered closing force for the fourth point in the force-torque graph.
Tip Force 5 defines the ordered closing force for the fifth point in the force-torque graph.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Measure the tip force and the motor torque for some different values.
Set Tip Force 1 to the tip force value of the first point you want to specify, and Motor Torque 1 to the corresponding motor torque.
Set Tip Force 2 to the tip force value of the second point you want to specify, and Motor Torque 2 to the corresponding motor torque.
Set Tip Force 3 to the tip force value of the third point you want to specify, and Motor Torque 3 to the corresponding motor torque.
Set Tip Force 4 to the tip force value of the fourth point you want to specify, and Motor Torque 4 to the corresponding motor torque.
Set Tip Force 5 to the tip force value of the fifth point you want to specify, and Motor Torque 5 to the corresponding motor torque.
It is possible to change the values for index 6-10 manually by changing a MOC.cfg.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Tip Force can only be used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 20000 (N).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Motor Torque 1 , Motor Torque 2 , Motor Torque 3 , Motor Torque 4 , and Motor Torque 5 belong to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Used to define the relation between tip force and motor torque for a servo gun (see Force-torque relation).
Motor Torque 1 defines the motor torque for the first point in the force-torque graph.
Motor Torque 2 defines the motor torque for the second point in the force-torque graph.
Motor Torque 3 defines the motor torque for the third point in the force-torque graph.
Motor Torque 4 defines the motor torque for the fourth point in the force-torque graph.
Motor Torque 5 defines the motor torque for the fifth point in the force-torque graph.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Measure the tip force and the motor torque for some different values
Set Motor Torque 1 to the motor torque value of the first point you want to specify, and Tip Force 1 to the corresponding tip force.
Set Motor Torque 2 to the motor torque value of the second point you want to specify, and Tip Force 2 to the corresponding tip force.
Set Motor Torque 3 to the motor torque value of the third point you want to specify, and Tip Force 3 to the corresponding tip force.
Set Motor Torque 4 to the motor torque value of the fourth point you want to specify, and Tip Force 4 to the corresponding tip force.
Set Motor Torque 5 to the motor torque value of the fifth point you want to specify, and Tip Force 5 to the corresponding tip force.
It is possible to change the values for index 6-10 manually by changing a MOC.cfg.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Motor Torque can only be used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between -1000 and 1000 (Nm).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Position 1 , Position 2 , Position 3 , Position 4 , and Position 5 belong to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Used to define the joint position for a servo gun in relation to a given tip force and motor torque (see Force-torque relation).
Position defines the joint position for the servo gun in the force-torque graph.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Position is used to control the servo gun when a change of force is ordered during welding.
It is possible to change the values for index 6-10 manually by changing a MOC.cfg.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Position can only be used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value typically between -0.02 and 0.02 (meters).
The default value is 0.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Max Gun Force belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Max Gun Force is set to highest force value that the gun can use.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Max Gun Force can be used in RAPID to supervise the maximum force of the servo gun.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Max Gun Force can only be used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value.
The unit of the value depends on the servo gun calibration.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Automatic open disabled belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Automatic open disabled defines if the tool should open or not when stop occurs. It is recommended for servo grippers, but not for servo guns.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If you want the servo tool to remain closed when a stop occurs, this parameter should be set.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Automatic open disabled can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.
Default value is No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Force matching deflection values belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The applied force that result in the deflections defined in Deflection in z direction Unit m and Deflection in x direction Unit m.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Apply the force Force matching deflection values and measure the deflection in z and x direction.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Force matching deflection values can only be used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value.
The unit of the value depends on the servo gun calibration.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Ramp time matching deflection values belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The time it takes for the servo gun to build up the force specified in Force matching deflection values.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: This data is used to calculate the robot movement for the servo gun deflection compensation.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Ramp time matching deflection values can only be used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 1 (s).
Default value is 0.1.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Deflection in z direction (m) belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: TCP deviation in z-direction caused of gun arm deflection when the gun is closed with the force specified in Force matching deflection values. This data is used for the deflection compensation movement of the robot.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Apply the force defined in Force matching deflection values and measure the deflection in z direction. Define this measured deflection in Deflection in z direction (m) .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Deflection in z direction (m) can only be used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 0.02 m.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Deflection in x direction (m) belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: TCP deviation in x-direction caused of gun arm deflection when the gun is closed with the force specified in Force matching deflection values. This data is used for the deflection compensation movement of the robot.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Apply the force defined in Force matching deflection values and measure the deflection in x direction. Define this measured deflection in Deflection in x direction (m) .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Deflection in x direction (m) can only be used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between -0.02 and 0.02 m.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Missing tip check distance
Missing tip check distance belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Missing tip check distance defines the distance for when to trigger an error that a tip is missing from the tool.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: For example, set this value to 75% of the tip size. If a tip is missing, the tool will continue to close after the normal squeeze position. If the distance to the normal squeeze position is larger than this value, an error message will appear, and the system goes to motor off.
Consider the motor movement during force squeeze and this parameter to avoid false triggering.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Missing tip check distance can only be used for servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.001 and 5 (m).
Default value is 5.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Max difference for gravity compensation
Max difference for gravity compensation belongs to the type SG Process , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Max difference for gravity compensation is set as the difference in force when the spot welding gun is closing in negative direction with respect to the gravity direction, compared to closing in positive direction with respect to the gravity direction.
This parameter is optional.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Max difference for gravity compensation can be used in spot welding applications to compensate force depending on servo gun movement with respect to gravity direction. It will be calculated by the calibration method in SpotWare.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Max difference for gravity compensation can only be used for servo tools and will only have an effect with SpotWare.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 1000.
The unit of the value depends on the servo gun calibration.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Single , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
The type single, type
Single contains a number of parameters that are common for a single in the robot system. The single is a mechanical unit with one joint. Parameters of this type are used to define which joint the single consist of and the base frame of the single.
A maximum of 12 instances of the type Single can be configured in a system.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Single , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Name defines the name of the single.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Serial Number Low Part belongs to the type Single , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Serial Number Low Part defines the low part of the singleâs serial number.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The low integer part of the serial number.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: An integer value with maximum nine digits.
Default value is 0.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Serial Number High Part belongs to the type Single , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Serial Number High Part defines the high part of the singleâs serial number.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The high part is the first four characters of the serial number.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum four characters.
Default value is 0000.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Use Single Type belongs to the type Single , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use Single Type defines what single type is used. For more information, see The Single Type type.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The single type is defined in the type Single Type .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Use Joint belongs to the type Single , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Use Joint defines which joint data to use for the single. For more information, see The Joint type.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The joints are defined in the type Joint .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Base Frame x , Base Frame y , and Base Frame z belong to the type Single in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Base Frame x defines the x-direction of the base frame position in relation to the world frame (in meters).
Base Frame y defines the y-direction of the base frame position in relation to the world frame (in meters).
Base Frame z defines the z-direction of the base frame position in relation to the world frame (in meters).
For more information, see How to define base frame.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between -1,000 and 1,000 meters.

title.phrase: Base Frame q1, q2, q3, q4

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Base Frame q1 , Base Frame q2 , Base Frame q3 , and Base Frame q4 belong to the type Single in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Base Frame q1 defines the first quaternion (q1) of the base frame orientation in relation to the world frame.
Base Frame q2 defines the second quaternion (q2) of the base frame orientation in relation to the world frame.
Base Frame q3 defines the third quaternion (q3) of the base frame orientation in relation to the world frame.
Base Frame q4 defines the fourth quaternion (q4) of the base frame orientation in relation to the world frame.
For more information, see How to define base frame.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between -1 and 1 specifying the orientation.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Base Frame Coordinated belongs to the type Single in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Base Frame Coordinated defines the name of robot or single that moves the base frame of this single. For more information, see How to define base frame.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Mech.Unit Not Moving Detection Level belongs to the type Single , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Mech.Unit Not Moving Detection Level defines the detection level for a Single for the system output Mechanical Unit Not Moving . For more information, see Mechanical Unit Not Moving and Mech.Unit Not Moving Detection Level.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Normally the output of Mechanical Unit Not Moving will be set only when the single is stopped. If the detection level is set for the speed of the single, the output will also be set when the speed of the single is lower than the defined level.
If the detection level is set both for a robot and a single running in the same motion group, all the axes of the robot and the single must move slower than its level to set the output.
If the detection level is set only for the single but not for the robot, the output will be set when the speed of the single is lower than the level regardless of the speed of the robot.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 1.
0.01 = 1% of motor max speed, disabled if 0.
The default value is 0.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Ignore joint world zones belongs to the type Single , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: If Ignore joint world zones is set, this axis will be excluded from consideration in all joint WorldZones, overriding any setting in the instructions WZHomeJointDef and WZLimJointDef .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: This parameter is useful if the system has an external axis. For example, a servo gun or a track motion, that should be excluded from the checks done by WZHomeJointDef and WZLimJointDef .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.
Default value is No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph:
Single weight in power sharing
Single weight in power sharing belongs to the type Single , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Single weight in power sharing is used to decide how power should be distributed between robots and singles in case the power supply in the controller is a limiting factor.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: If a movement with both a robot and a positioner needs to be limited due to power supply then the single's part of the total power will be decided by this parameter.
If robot performance is prioritized then Robot weight in power sharing should be increased and vice versa if single performance is preferred.

wrapper.title: Example
wrapper.paragraph: If the power supply has 10 kW with a robot on a track motion and the total required power for a movement would be, for the robot 10 kW and track 2 kW. Then the parameters can be set as follows:

listitem.paragraph: Robot weight in power sharing : 90
Single weight in power sharing : 10

wrapper.paragraph: In this case the distribution of the available power would be 9 kW for robot and 1 kW for track.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 1000000.
Default value is 1.

wrapper.title: Additional information
wrapper.paragraph: This parameter does not need a restart of the controller to apply the changes. Hence, it is possible to test directly after changing the parameter value.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Single Type which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
The type single type, type
Single Type contains a number of parameters that are common for a single type in the robot system. The single is a mechanical unit with one joint. For more information, see The Single type.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Single Type in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Name defines the name of the single type.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Mechanics belongs to the type Single Type in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Mechanics defines what type of mechanics the single type uses.

wrapper.title: Limitation
wrapper.paragraph: The value TRACK is only used when a robot is mounted on a track. For a linear axis without a mounted robot, the value FREE_ROT shall be used and the parameter Rotating Move shall be set to No (type Transmission ).

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: The following mechanics are available/allowed:

td.paragraph: Linear track motion, only used when a robot is mounted on the track

section.title: Type SIS Parameters and SIS Single Parameters
The SIS Parameters type and the SIS Single Parameters type

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the types SIS Parameters and SIS Single Parameters which belong to the topic Motion . Each parameter of these types is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
The type SIS Parameters, type
SIS Parameters describes the service intervals and warning levels for the robot. The service interval can be set in both production time and calendar time.

The type SIS Single Parameters, type
SIS Single Parameters describes the service intervals and warning levels for external axes. The service interval can be set in both production time and calendar time.
The parameters for the types SIS Parameters and SIS Single Parameters are identical in usage and allowed values. Therefore they are described together in this manual.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Changing the parameter values in SIS Single Parameters is only useful if you have one or more external axes.

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph: See the product manual for the robot.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type SIS Parameters in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Name defines the SIS parameter name.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Operational Limit (h) belongs to the type SIS Parameters in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Operational Limit (h) describes the service interval measured in production time.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The service interval for production time, Operational Limit (h) , for ABB robots is normally set on delivery and should be changed if the value differs from the maintenance schedule in the product manual.
When the Operational Limit (h) is reached, the FlexPendant displays a message from the elog.
If Operational Limit (h) is set to 0, the function is disabled.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 50000 hours.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Calendar Limit (years) belongs to the type SIS Parameters in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Calendar Limit (years) defines the service interval in calendar time.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The service interval for calendar time, Calendar Limit (years) , for ABB robots is normally set on delivery and should be changed if the value differs from the maintenance schedule in the product manual.
When the Calendar Limit (years) is reached, the FlexPendant displays a message from the elog.
If Calendar Limit (years) is set to 0, the function is disabled.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 20 years.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Operational Warning (%) belongs to the type SIS Parameters in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Operational Warning (%) defines when the warning before reached service level for production time should occur.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The value of Operational Warning (%) is a percentage of the Operational Limit (h) . A higher number gives a shorter time between the warning and the reached service level.
If Operational Warning (%) is set to 0, the warning is disabled.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 100 %.

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph: Operational Limit.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Calendar Warning (%) belongs to the type SIS Parameters in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Calendar Warning (%) defines when the warning before reached service level for calender time should occur.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The value of Calendar Warning (%) is a percentage of the Calendar Limit (years) . A higher number gives a shorter time between the warning and the reached service level.
If Calendar Warning (%) is set to 0, the warning is disabled.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 100 %.

wrapper.title: Related information
wrapper.paragraph: Calendar Limit.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Gearbox Warning (%) belongs to the type SIS Parameters in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Gearbox Warning (%) defines when the warning before reached service level for gearbox should occur.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The estimated gearbox service interval (remaining lifetime) is calculated automatically. The value of Gearbox Warning (%) is a percentage of the estimated gearbox service interval. A higher number gives a shorter time between the warning and the reached service level.
For an ABB robot using SIS, the value is typically set to 100.
If Gearbox Warning (%) is set to 0, the warning is disabled.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 100 %.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Robot temperature (C) and Single temperature (C) belong to the type SIS Parameters , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Robot temperature (C) and Single temperature (C) defines the ambient temperature (Â°C).

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The gearbox service interval (remaining lifetime) is calculated automatically, using among other things Robot temperature (C) or Single temperature (C) . For an ABB robot using SIS, the value is typically set to 50 and should be changed if the value differs from the value defined in the product manual.
The temperature value can be changed to the actual temperature of the location where the robot is used.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 35 and 50.
If a value lower than 35 is defined, then 35 will be used.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Events as Warnings belongs to the type SIS Parameters in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Events as Warnings defines whether SIS event logs should be warnings instead of errors.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set to Yes when you want the SIS event logs to be reported as warnings instead of errors. The main difference is that warnings donât take focus on the FlexPendant, and that they have a different icon. This will affect calendar time events, production time events, and gearbox events.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No .

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Stress Duty Cycle , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of the type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
The type stress duty cycle, type
Stress Duty Cycle is used to protect axes, gearboxes, etc. Damage due to too high mechanical forces are avoided by setting limits for speed and torque.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Parameters of the type Stress Duty Cycle can only be defined for additional axes.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Stress Duty Cycle , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The name of the Stress Duty Cycle .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Name is used to reference a Stress Duty Cycle from the parameter Use Stress Duty Cycle in the type Drive System .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Speed Absolute Max belongs to the type Stress Duty Cycle , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The absolute highest motor speed to be used.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Limit the motor speed with Speed Absolute Max to avoid too much stress on the axis. If, for example, the gearbox is the limiter for the speed, set Speed Absolute Max to a value that will protect the gearbox.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 1500 (rad/s on motor side).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Torque Absolute Max belongs to the type Stress Duty Cycle , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The absolute highest motor torque to be used.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Limit the motor torque with Torque Absolute Max to avoid too much stress on the axis. If, for example, the gearbox is the limiter for the torque, set Torque Absolute Max to a value that will protect the gearbox.

wrapper.title: Limitation
wrapper.paragraph: Torque Absolute Max can only be defined for additional axes.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 100000 (Nm on motor side).

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Supervision , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of the type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph: The type Supervision is used for supervision of joints. Each joint has one set of parameters of the type Supervision . For more information, see The Joint type.

wrapper.title: Limitation
wrapper.paragraph: Parameters of the type Supervision can only be defined for additional axes.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Supervision , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The name of the supervision.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Brake Release Supervision On belongs to the type Supervision , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Brake Release Supervision On defines if the brake release supervision is on or off.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Brake Release Supervision On to On to turn on brake release supervision. This activates a position supervision algorithm during brake release.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: On or Off

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Speed Supervision belongs to the type Supervision , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines if the speed supervision should be activated or not.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Speed supervision should normally be On.
NOTE! Deactivating the speed supervision can be dangerous.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: On or Off

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Position Supervision belongs to the type Supervision , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines if the position supervision should be activated or not.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The position supervision should normally be On.
NOTE! Deactivating the position supervision can be dangerous.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: On or Off

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Counter Supervision belongs to the type Supervision , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines if the measurement system supervision should be activated or not.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The counter supervision should normally be On.
NOTE! Deactivating the counter supervision can be dangerous.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: On or Off

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Jam Supervision belongs to the type Supervision , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines if the jam supervision should be activated or not.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The jam supervision should normally be activated (On).
NOTE! Deactivating the jam supervision can be dangerous.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: On or Off

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Load Supervision belongs to the type Supervision , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines if the load supervision should be activated or not.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The load supervision should normally be On.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: On or Off

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Power Up Position Supervision belongs to the type Supervision , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines if the power up position supervision should be activated or not.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The power up position supervision should normally be On.
NOTE! Deactivating the power up position supervision can be dangerous.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: On or Off

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: In Position Range belongs to the type Supervision , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the allowed position deviation from fine point when the axis is considered to have reached the fine point.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Normally set to 1.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 1000000 radians on motor side.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Zero Speed (%) belongs to the type Supervision , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the maximum speed when the axis is considered to be standing still.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Normally set to 0.02.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 1, where 1 equals max speed.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Affects Forced Control belongs to the type Supervision , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines if the joint affects the in position forced control used in fine point.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set to No if the joint should affect the in position forced control.
The forced control is used to reduce time for axis to go into the fine point.
For more information, see Forced Control Active.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Forced on Position Limit belongs to the type Supervision , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The upper position limit for activation of forced control, measured from the fine point. For more information, see Affects Forced Control.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The upper position limit is measured in radians on the motor shaft.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 5.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Forced off Position Limit belongs to the type Supervision , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The lower position limit for deactivation of forced control used close to the fine point. For more information, see Affects Forced Control.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The lower position limit is measured in radians on the motor shaft.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Must have a lower value than Forced on Position Limit . For more information, see Forced on Position Limit.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 5.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Thermal Supervision Sensitivity Ratio belongs to the type Supervision , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Parameter used for tuning the thermal motor model. High value increases the temperature in the model.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: The thermal supervision is only available for motor units (MU 200, MU 300, MU 400) and gear units (MTD 250, MTD 500, MTD 750, 200 MID 500, MID 1000).

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0.5 and 2.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Supervision Type , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of the type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
The type supervision type, type
Supervision Type is used for continuos supervision of position, speed and torque. These values should follow the planned path, within a tolerance interval, or the movement is stopped.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Parameters of the type Supervision Type can only be defined for additional axes.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Supervision Type , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The name of the Supervision Type .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Name is used to reference a Supervision Type from the parameter Use Supervision Type in the type Supervision .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Max Force Control Position Error belongs to the type Supervision Type , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Max allowed position error during force control.
If the position error is larger than Max Force Control Position Error , all movement is stopped.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: When a servo gun is in force control mode it is not allowed to move more than the distance specified in Max Force Control Position Error .
The most common reasons for a servo gun to move during force control are:

listitem.paragraph: the servo gun is flexible and can give in when high forces are applied

the force control may start before the gun has closed around the plate, e.g. because the ordered plate thickness is larger than the real plate thickness, or because the parameter Close position adjust is set to a value larger than 0.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Max Force Control Position Error can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 0.2 (meter).
The default value is 0.03.
