wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Max Force Control Speed Limit belongs to the type Supervision Type , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Speed error factor during force control.

The speed limits for force control is defined in the type Force Master Control . If this speed limit multiplied with Max Force Control Speed Limit is exceeded, all movement is stopped. For more information, see The Force Master Control.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The speed may for a short period of time exceed the speed limit (defined in type Force Master Control ) before it is regulated to a value within the limits. To allow the speed to exceed the limit during this regulation without stopping all movement, Max Force Control Speed Limit must be set to a value larger than 1. How much the speed is allowed to over-shoot the limit is determined by Max Force Control Speed Limit .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Max Force Control Speed Limit can only be used if you have servo tools.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 1 and 10. The value has no unit, but is a ratio of the speed limit defined in the type Force Master Control .
The default value is 1.1.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Dynamic Power Up Position Limit belongs to the type Supervision Type , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the maximum accepted power up position error at maximum speed.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Dynamic Power Up Position Limit sets a dynamic limit for measurement system supervision of moment during power fail.
A typical value is 120% of the maximum brake distance.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 1000 in radians.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Teach Max Speed Main belongs to the type Supervision Type , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines maximum ordered speed in manual mode.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Teach Max Speed Main is used to limit the maximum speed in manual mode.
The value of Teach Max Speed Main should be set so that the arm speed does not exceeds 250 mm/s.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A ratio value between 0 and 1, where 1 equals max speed.

title.phrase: Incorrectly defined tool load can cause exceeded 250 mm/s

wrapper.paragraph: Incorrectly defined parameters will result in incorrect speed. Always verify the speed after changing these parameters.
There is a hazard that the speed 250 mm/s is exceeded in manual reduced speed mode.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Teach Max Speed DSP belongs to the type Supervision Type , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the motor speed supervision level in manual mode.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Teach Max Speed DSP is used for speed supervision in manual mode. The value of Teach Max Speed DSP should be set to the same value as Teach Max Speed Main added with a margin for noise and vibrations. Typical value is the largest value of ( Teach Max Speed Main * 1.20) or ( Teach Max Speed Main + 8/ Speed Absolute Max ).

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A ratio value between 0 and 1, where 1 equals max speed.

title.phrase: Incorrectly defined tool load can cause exceeded 250 mm/s

wrapper.paragraph: Incorrectly defined parameters will result in incorrect speed. Always verify the speed after changing these parameters.
There is a hazard that the speed 250 mm/s is exceeded in manual reduced speed mode.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Max Jam Time belongs to the type Supervision Type , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the maximum allowed time with maximum torque at zero speed.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Max Jam Time to protect the robot and equipment from faults and damage that may occur if the torque is high while the speed is zero.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 2.0 seconds.
A typical value is 0.5.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Max Overload Time belongs to the type Supervision Type , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the maximum allowed time with maximum torque while moving.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Set Max Overload Time to protect the robot and equipment from faults and damage. If Max Overload Time is exceeded, the controller will indicate an error in hardware, robot, load, or programming.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 20 seconds.
A typical value is 0.2.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Auto Max Speed Supervision Limit belongs to the type Supervision Type , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the maximum speed supervision limit in automatic mode.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Auto Max Speed Supervision Limit is typically set to 1.2 to allow margin against speed overshoot, interference from external forces, etc.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 5, where 1 equals max speed.
A typical value is 1.2.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Influence Group belongs to the type Supervision Type , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Defines the type of influence group for the Supervision Type . An influence group is a group of axes, mechanically affecting each other.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Influence Group is used to calculate supervision levels.
Normally, for axes not affecting each other, deactivate the function by setting Influence Group to 0.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: An integer between 0 and 10.

title.phrase: Alarm Position Limit for Brake Release

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Alarm Position Limit for Brake Release belongs to the type Supervision Type , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Alarm Position Limit for Brake Release defines the emergency stop limit for position supervision during brake release.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: An emergency stop is generated if the axis motor moves more than the defined value of Alarm Position Limit for Brake Release directly after brake release.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 1000, defined in radians on motor side.
Default value is 1.0.

title.phrase: Position OK Ratio for Brake Release

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Position OK Ratio for Brake Release belongs to the type Supervision Type , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Position OK Ratio for Brake Release defines the maximum position error for the axis when the axis should leave the brake supervision state and change to normal operation.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The value of Position OK Ratio for Brake Release is a ratio of the value of parameter Alarm Position Limit for Brake Release . For more information, see Alarm Position Limit for Brake Release.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A value between 0 and 1.
Default value is 0.2, a normal value is 0.2-0.5.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Transmission , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of this type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
Each set of parameters of the type transmission, type
Transmission belongs to a joint (robot joint or additional axis).
The parameters in Transmission determine the transmission gear ratio between the motor and the axis.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: The transmission gear ratio can only be defined for additional axes.
The transmission gear ratio for the robot joints are defined by ABB and cannot be changed.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Transmission , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The name of the Transmission .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Name is used to reference a Transmission from the parameter Use Transmission in the type Joint .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Rotating Move belongs to the type Transmission , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Rotating Move defines if the axis is rotating or linear.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: For rotating axes, set Rotating Move to Yes. For linear axes, set Rotating Move to No.
Rotating Move affects if the transmission gear ratio is defined as motor radians per joint radians, or motor radian per joint meter.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: Yes or No.
The default value is No.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Transmission Gear Ratio belongs to the type Transmission , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Transmission Gear Ratio defines the transmission gear ratio between motor and joint.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: For rotating axes, set Transmission Gear Ratio to the number of revolutions the motor performs for every revolution of the joint. For linear axes, set Transmission Gear Ratio to motor radians per meter.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Transmission Gear Ratio can only be defined for external axes. Transmission Gear Ratio for the robot joints are defined by ABB and cannot be changed.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between -100000 and +100000.

title.phrase: Incorrectly defined tool load can cause exceeded 250 mm/s

wrapper.paragraph: Incorrectly defined parameters will result in incorrect speed. Always verify the speed after changing these parameters.
There is a hazard that the speed 250 mm/s is exceeded in manual reduced speed mode.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Transmission Gear High belongs to the type Transmission , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: When a joint is in independent mode, Transmission Gear High is the numerator in the fraction representing the transmission gear ratio between motor and joint. The denominator is the parameter Transmission Gear Low .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: When a joint is set to independent mode, the transmission gear ratio is represented as Transmission Gear High divided by Transmission Gear Low . See How to define transmission gear ratio for independent joints for more information on how to use these parameters.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Transmission Gear High is only useful if you have the RobotWare option Independent Axes .
When a joint is not in independent mode, it uses the parameter Transmission Gear Ratio instead of Transmission Gear High and Transmission Gear Low .
For more information, see Transmission Gear Low.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: An integer value except 0.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Transmission Gear Low belongs to the type Transmission , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: When a joint is in independent mode, Transmission Gear Low is the denominator in the fraction representing the transmission gear ratio between motor and joint. The numerator is the parameter Transmission Gear High .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph:
When a joint is set to independent mode, the transmission gear ratio is represented as Transmission Gear High divided by Transmission Gear Low . See
How to define transmission gear ratio for independent joints
for more information on how to use these parameters.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: The parameter Transmission Gear Low is only useful if you have the RobotWare option Independent Axes .
When a joint is not in independent mode, it uses the parameter Transmission Gear Ratio instead of Transmission Gear High and Transmission Gear Low .
For more information, see Transmission Gear High.

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: An integer value except 0.

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: This section describes the type Uncalibrated Control Master 0 , which belongs to the topic Motion . Each parameter of the type is described in a separate information topic in this section.

wrapper.title: Type description
wrapper.paragraph:
The type uncalibrated control master, type
Uncalibrated Control Master 0 is used to regulate uncalibrated axes. If one axis in a mechanical unit is uncalibrated, Uncalibrated Control Master 0 is used to regulate all axes in that mechanical unit.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Name belongs to the type Uncalibrated Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: The name of the Uncalibrated Control Master 0 .

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Name is used to reference an Uncalibrated Control Master 0 from the parameter Uncalibrated Control Master in the type Joint .

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A string with maximum 32 characters.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Kp, Gain Position Loop belongs to the type Uncalibrated Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Proportional gain in the position regulation loop.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The higher the value of Kp, Gain Position Loop , the better tracking and disturbance rejection.
If the position regulation overshoots, decrease Kp, Gain Position Loop .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Kp, Gain Position Loop only affects the axis when it is uncalibrated (or when another axis in the same mechanical unit is uncalibrated).

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 1000 (1/s).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Kv, Gain Speed Loop belongs to the type Uncalibrated Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Proportional gain in the speed regulation loop.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The higher the value of Kv, Gain Speed Loop , the better tracking and disturbance rejection.
If the level of oscillation or noise is too high, decrease Kv, Gain Speed Loop .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Kv, Gain Speed Loop only affects the axis when it is uncalibrated (or when another axis in the same mechanical unit is uncalibrated).

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 100 (Nms/rad).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Ti Integration Time Speed Loop belongs to the type Uncalibrated Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Integration time in the speed regulation loop.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: The lower the value of Ti Integration Time Speed Loop , the better tracking and disturbance rejection.
If the level of oscillation or noise is too high, increase Ti Integration Time Speed Loop .

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Ti Integration Time Speed Loop only affects the axis when it is uncalibrated (or when another axis in the same mechanical unit is uncalibrated).

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 10 seconds.
The default value is 10.

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Speed Max Uncalibrated belongs to the type Uncalibrated Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Speed Max Uncalibrated defines the maximum allowed speed for an uncalibrated axis.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Use Speed Max Uncalibrated as a limit for the speed of the axis when it is regulated as an uncalibrated axis.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Speed Max Uncalibrated only affects the axis when it is uncalibrated (or when another axis in the same mechanical unit is uncalibrated).

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 670 (rad/s on motor side).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Acceleration Max Uncalibrated belongs to the type Uncalibrated Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Acceleration Max Uncalibrated defines the maximum allowed acceleration for an uncalibrated axis.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Use Acceleration Max Uncalibrated as a limit for the acceleration of the axis when it is regulated as an uncalibrated axis.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Acceleration Max Uncalibrated only affects the axis when it is uncalibrated (or when another axis in the same mechanical unit is uncalibrated).

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 10000 (rad/s2 on motor side).

wrapper.title: Parent
wrapper.paragraph: Deceleration Max Uncalibrated belongs to the type Uncalibrated Control Master 0 , in the topic Motion .

wrapper.title: Description
wrapper.paragraph: Deceleration Max Uncalibrated defines the maximum allowed deceleration for an uncalibrated axis.

wrapper.title: Usage
wrapper.paragraph: Use Deceleration Max Uncalibrated as a limit for the deceleration of the axis when it is regulated as an uncalibrated axis.

wrapper.title: Limitations
wrapper.paragraph: Deceleration Max Uncalibrated only affects the axis when it is uncalibrated (or when another axis in the same mechanical unit is uncalibrated).

wrapper.title: Allowed values
wrapper.paragraph: A numeric value between 0 and 10000 (rad/s2 on motor side).

wrapper.title: Overview
wrapper.paragraph: The Process topic contains parameters for configuring various process applications. These parameters are described in the application manuals for the respective options.
